guiQt.controller

uHDR GUI Controller Module

This module implements the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern for the uHDR graphical user interface. It provides comprehensive controller classes that manage user interactions, coordinate between GUI components, and handle image processing workflows.

The controller system manages multiple aspects of the HDR editing interface:

  • Image gallery navigation and display
  • HDR image editing controls and parameters
  • Processing pipeline management
  • File operations and metadata handling
  • Multi-monitor HDR display support

Classes: - GalleryMode: Enumeration for gallery display layouts - ImageWidgetController: Individual image widget management - ImageGalleryController: Image gallery navigation and selection - AppController: Main application controller and workflow coordination - MultiDockController: Multi-panel interface management - EditImageController: HDR image editing controls and parameters - ImageInfoController: Image metadata and information display - AdvanceSliderController: Advanced slider control with auto-adjustment - ToneCurveController: Tone curve editing and B-spline management - LightnessMaskController: Lightness mask controls for tone range selection - HDRviewerController: HDR image display and comparison - LchColorSelectorController: LCH color space editing interface - GeometryController: Geometric transformation controls - ImageAestheticsController: Image aesthetics analysis and display

Key Features: - Complete MVC architecture for HDR image editing - Multi-threaded processing with progress indicators - HDR display management and calibration - Advanced color editing with LCH color space support - Tone curve editing with B-spline interpolation - Batch processing and export capabilities - Real-time preview and comparison tools

  20# --- Package hdrGUI ---------------------------------------------------------
  21# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  22"""
  23uHDR GUI Controller Module
  24
  25This module implements the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern for the uHDR
  26graphical user interface. It provides comprehensive controller classes that
  27manage user interactions, coordinate between GUI components, and handle
  28image processing workflows.
  29
  30The controller system manages multiple aspects of the HDR editing interface:
  31- Image gallery navigation and display
  32- HDR image editing controls and parameters
  33- Processing pipeline management
  34- File operations and metadata handling
  35- Multi-monitor HDR display support
  36
  37Classes:
  38    - GalleryMode: Enumeration for gallery display layouts
  39    - ImageWidgetController: Individual image widget management
  40    - ImageGalleryController: Image gallery navigation and selection
  41    - AppController: Main application controller and workflow coordination
  42    - MultiDockController: Multi-panel interface management
  43    - EditImageController: HDR image editing controls and parameters
  44    - ImageInfoController: Image metadata and information display
  45    - AdvanceSliderController: Advanced slider control with auto-adjustment
  46    - ToneCurveController: Tone curve editing and B-spline management
  47    - LightnessMaskController: Lightness mask controls for tone range selection
  48    - HDRviewerController: HDR image display and comparison
  49    - LchColorSelectorController: LCH color space editing interface
  50    - GeometryController: Geometric transformation controls
  51    - ImageAestheticsController: Image aesthetics analysis and display
  52
  53Key Features:
  54    - Complete MVC architecture for HDR image editing
  55    - Multi-threaded processing with progress indicators
  56    - HDR display management and calibration
  57    - Advanced color editing with LCH color space support
  58    - Tone curve editing with B-spline interpolation
  59    - Batch processing and export capabilities
  60    - Real-time preview and comparison tools
  61"""

  63# --- Import ------------------------------------------------------------------
  64# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  85def getScreenSize(app):
  86    """
  87    Get screen resolution information for multi-monitor support.
  88    
  89    Queries the application for all available screens and returns their
  90    dimensions for HDR display configuration and window management.
  91    
  92    Args:
  93        app (QApplication): PyQt5 application instance
  94        
  95    Returns:
  96        list: List of QSize objects representing screen dimensions
  97    """
  98    screens = app.screens()
  99    res = list(map(lambda x: x.size(), screens))
 100    return res
 101# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 102# --- Class GalleryMode -------------------------------------------------------
 103# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 104class GalleryMode(enum.Enum):
 105    """
 106    Enumeration for gallery display layout configurations.
 107    
 108    Defines different grid layouts for the image gallery, allowing users
 109    to view multiple images simultaneously in various arrangements.
 110    Each mode specifies the number of rows and columns for image display.
 111    
 112    Attributes:
 113        - _1x1 (int): Single image view (1 row, 1 column)
 114        - _3x2 (int): 32 grid layout (2 rows, 3 columns)
 115        - _6x4 (int): 64 grid layout (4 rows, 6 columns)
 116        - _9x6 (int): 96 grid layout (6 rows, 9 columns)
 117        - _2x1 (int): 21 layout (1 row, 2 columns) for side-by-side comparison
 118    """
 119
 120    _1x1         = 0         # 
 121    _3x2         = 1         # 
 122    _6x4         = 2         # 
 123    _9x6         = 3         #
 124    
 125    _2x1        =  4
 126
 127    def nbRow(m):
 128        """
 129        Get the number of rows for a gallery mode.
 130        
 131        Args:
 132            m (GalleryMode): Gallery mode enumeration value
 133            
 134        Returns:
 135            int: Number of rows in the gallery layout
 136        """
 137        if m == GalleryMode._1x1: return 1
 138        if m == GalleryMode._3x2: return 2
 139        if m == GalleryMode._6x4: return 4
 140        if m == GalleryMode._9x6: return 6
 141
 142        if m == GalleryMode._2x1: return 1
 143    def nbCol(m):
 144        """
 145        Get the number of columns for a gallery mode.
 146        
 147        Args:
 148            m (GalleryMode): Gallery mode enumeration value
 149            
 150        Returns:
 151            int: Number of columns in the gallery layout
 152        """
 153        if m == GalleryMode._1x1: return 1
 154        if m == GalleryMode._3x2: return 3
 155        if m == GalleryMode._6x4: return 6
 156        if m == GalleryMode._9x6: return 9
 157
 158        if m == GalleryMode._2x1: return 2
 159# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 160# --- Class ImageWidgetController ---------------------------------------------
 161# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 162class ImageWidgetController:
 163    """
 164    Controller for individual image widget components.
 165    
 166    Manages the display and interaction of individual image widgets within
 167    the gallery and editing interface. Handles image loading, display
 168    updates, and user interactions for single image components.
 169    
 170    Attributes:
 171        - model (model.ImageWidgetModel): Data model for the image widget
 172        - view (view.ImageWidgetView): View component for image display
 173        - _id (int): Unique identifier for the widget
 174    """
 175
 176    def __init__(self, image=None,id = -1):
 177        """
 178        Initialize an image widget controller.
 179        
 180        Args:
 181            image (numpy.ndarray or hdrCore.image.Image, optional): Initial image to display
 182            id (int, optional): Unique identifier for the widget (default: -1)
 183        """
 184
 185        self.model = model.ImageWidgetModel(self)
 186        self.view = view.ImageWidgetView(self)
 187
 188        self._id = id # store an (unique) id 
 189
 190        if isinstance(image, (np.ndarray, hdrCore.image.Image)):
 191            self.model.setImage(image)
 192            self.view.setPixmap(self.model.getColorData())
 193
 194    def setImage(self, image):
 195        """
 196        Update the image displayed in the widget.
 197        
 198        Args:
 199            image (numpy.ndarray or hdrCore.image.Image): New image to display
 200            
 201        Returns:
 202            QPixmap: Updated pixmap for the display
 203        """
 204        self.model.setImage(image)
 205        return self.view.setPixmap(self.model.getColorData())
 206
 207    def setQPixmap(self, qPixmap):
 208        """
 209        Set the display pixmap directly.
 210        
 211        Args:
 212            qPixmap (QPixmap): Pixmap to display in the widget
 213        """
 214        self.view.setQPixmap(qPixmap)
 215
 216    def id(self): 
 217        """
 218        Get the widget's unique identifier.
 219        
 220        Returns:
 221            int: Unique identifier for this widget
 222        """
 223        return self._id
 224# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 225# --- Class ImageGalleryController --------------------------------------------
 226# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 227class ImageGalleryController():
 228    """
 229    Controller for the image gallery interface.
 230    
 231    Manages the gallery view that displays multiple images in grid layouts,
 232    handles pagination, gallery mode switching, and image selection. Provides
 233    the main interface for browsing and selecting images for editing.
 234    
 235    The gallery supports multiple display modes (11, 32, 64, 96, 21) and
 236    handles pagination when there are more images than can fit in the current view.
 237    
 238    Attributes:
 239        - parent: Parent controller (typically AppController)
 240        - view (view.ImageGalleryView): Gallery view component
 241        - model (model.ImageGalleryModel): Gallery data model
 242    """
 243
 244    def __init__(self, parent):
 245        """
 246        Initialize the image gallery controller.
 247        
 248        Args:
 249            parent: Parent controller that manages this gallery
 250        """
 251        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.__init__()")
 252
 253        self.parent = parent    # AppView
 254        self.view = view.ImageGalleryView(self)
 255        self.model = model.ImageGalleryModel(self)
 256
 257    def setImages(self, imageFiles): 
 258        """
 259        Load a list of image files into the gallery.
 260        
 261        Args:
 262            imageFiles (list): List of image file paths to load
 263        """
 264        self.model.setImages(imageFiles)
 265
 266    def updateImages(self):
 267        """
 268        Refresh the gallery display with current images.
 269        
 270        Called by the model when image data changes to update the view.
 271        Resets the page number and refreshes the display.
 272        """
 273        self.view.pageNumber = 0 # reset page number
 274        self.view.updateImages()
 275
 276    def callBackButton_previousPage(self):  
 277        """
 278        Navigate to the previous page in the gallery.
 279        
 280        Handles pagination when there are more images than can fit in the
 281        current gallery view. In single image mode, also selects the image.
 282        """
 283        self.view.changePageNumber(-1)
 284        if self.view.shapeMode == GalleryMode._1x1 : self.selectImage(0)
 285
 286    def callBackButton_nextPage(self):      
 287        """
 288        Navigate to the next page in the gallery.
 289        
 290        Handles pagination when there are more images than can fit in the
 291        current gallery view. In single image mode, also selects the image.
 292        """
 293        self.view.changePageNumber(+1)
 294        if self.view.shapeMode == GalleryMode._1x1 : self.selectImage(0)
 295
 296    def computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(self,newGalleryMode):
 297        """
 298        Calculate the appropriate page number when changing gallery modes.
 299        
 300        When switching between different gallery layouts, this method ensures
 301        the currently selected or viewed image remains visible by calculating
 302        the correct page number for the new layout.
 303        
 304        Args:
 305            newGalleryMode (GalleryMode): Target gallery layout mode
 306            
 307        Returns:
 308            int: Calculated page number for the new gallery mode
 309        """
 310        currentPage = self.view.pageNumber
 311        nbImagePerPage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
 312        selectedImage = self.model.selectedImage() if (self.model.selectedImage()!=-1) else currentPage*nbImagePerPage
 313        newNbImagePerPage = GalleryMode.nbRow(newGalleryMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(newGalleryMode)
 314
 315        newPageNumber = selectedImage//newNbImagePerPage
 316
 317        return newPageNumber
 318
 319    def callBackButton_1x1(self):
 320        """
 321        Switch gallery to single image view mode (11).
 322        
 323        Changes the gallery layout to display one image at a time, suitable
 324        for detailed viewing and editing. Recalculates pagination and updates
 325        the display.
 326        """
 327        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._1x1:
 328            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
 329            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._1x1)
 330            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._1x1
 331            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 332            self.view.updateImages()
 333            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
 334            self.view.repaint()
 335
 336    def callBackButton_3x2(self): 
 337        """
 338        Switch gallery to 32 grid view mode.
 339        
 340        Changes the gallery layout to display 6 images in a 32 grid,
 341        suitable for browsing multiple images while maintaining reasonable
 342        image size for preview.
 343        """
 344        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._3x2:
 345            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
 346            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._3x2)
 347            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._3x2
 348            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 349            self.view.updateImages()
 350            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
 351            self.view.repaint()
 352
 353    def callBackButton_6x4(self): 
 354        """
 355        Switch gallery to 64 grid view mode.
 356        
 357        Changes the gallery layout to display 24 images in a 64 grid,
 358        suitable for quick browsing of large image collections with
 359        smaller thumbnail sizes.
 360        """
 361        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._6x4:
 362            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
 363            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._6x4)
 364            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._6x4
 365            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 366            self.view.updateImages()
 367            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
 368            self.view.repaint()
 369
 370    def callBackButton_9x6(self):
 371        """
 372        Switch gallery to 96 grid view mode.
 373        
 374        Changes the gallery layout to display 54 images in a 96 grid,
 375        suitable for overview browsing of very large image collections
 376        with small thumbnail sizes.
 377        """
 378        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._9x6:
 379            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
 380            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._9x6)
 381            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._9x6
 382            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 383            self.view.updateImages()
 384            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
 385            self.view.repaint()
 386
 387    def callBackButton_2x1(self):
 388        """
 389        Switch gallery to 21 comparison view mode.
 390        
 391        Changes the gallery layout to display 2 images side by side,
 392        ideal for comparing different processing results or comparing
 393        before/after versions of images.
 394        """
 395        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._2x1:
 396            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
 397            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._2x1)
 398            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._2x1
 399            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 400            self.view.updateImages()
 401            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
 402            self.view.repaint()
 403
 404    def selectImage(self, id):
 405        """
 406        Handle selection of an image in the gallery.
 407        
 408        Processes user selection of an image and updates the editing interface
 409        to work with the selected image's processing pipeline.
 410        
 411        Args:
 412            id (int): Index of the selected image within the current page
 413        """
 414        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.selectImage()")
 415
 416        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
 417        idxImage = self.view.pageNumber*nbImagePage+id
 418        # check id
 419        if (idxImage < len(self.model.processPipes)):
 420            # update selected image
 421            processPipe = self.model.processPipes[idxImage]
 422            if processPipe:
 423                if self.parent.dock.setProcessPipe(processPipe):
 424                    self.model.setSelectedImage(idxImage)
 425
 426    def getSelectedProcessPipe(self):
 427        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.getSelectedProcessPipe()")
 428        return self.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
 429
 430    def setProcessPipeWidgetQPixmap(self, qPixmap):
 431        idxProcessPipe = self.model.selectedImage()
 432        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
 433        idxImageWidget = idxProcessPipe%nbImagePage
 434        if pref.verbose:  print(" >> ImageGalleryController.setProcessPipeWidgetQPixmap(...)[ image id:",idxProcessPipe,">> image widget controller:",idxImageWidget,"]")
 435        self.view.imagesControllers[idxImageWidget].setQPixmap(qPixmap)
 436
 437    def save(self):
 438        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.save()")
 439        self.model.save()
 440
 441    def currentPage(self): return self.view.currentPage()
 442
 443    def pageIdx(self):
 444        nb = self.currentPage()
 445        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
 446        return (nb*nbImagePage), ((nb+1)*nbImagePage)
 447
 448    def getFilenamesOfCurrentPage(self): return self.model.getFilenamesOfCurrentPage()
 449
 450    def getProcessPipeById(self,i) : return self.model.getProcessPipeById(i)
 451
 452    def getProcessPipes(self): return self.model.processPipes
 453# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 454# --- Class AppController -----------------------------------------------------
 455# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 456class AppController(object):
 457    """
 458    Main application controller implementing the MVC pattern.
 459    
 460    This class serves as the central controller for the uHDR application,
 461    managing the main window, coordinating between different components,
 462    and handling high-level application operations like file management,
 463    HDR display, and image export functionality.
 464    
 465    The AppController orchestrates interactions between the image gallery,
 466    editing interface, HDR viewer, and manages the application's workflow
 467    from image loading to final export operations.
 468    
 469    Attributes:
 470        - screenSize (list): Available screen dimensions for multi-monitor support
 471        - hdrDisplay (HDRviewerController): HDR image display controller
 472        - view (view.AppView): Main application view component
 473        - model (model.AppModel): Main application data model
 474        - dirName (str): Currently selected directory path
 475        - imagesName (list): List of image filenames in current directory
 476    """
 477
 478    def __init__(self, app):
 479        """
 480        Initialize the main application controller.
 481        
 482        Sets up the application's core components including screen detection,
 483        HDR display initialization, and main view creation. Establishes the
 484        foundation for the complete HDR editing workflow.
 485        
 486        Args:
 487            app (QApplication): PyQt5 application instance for screen detection
 488        """
 489        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.__init__()")
 490
 491        self.screenSize = getScreenSize(app)# get screens size
 492
 493        # attributes
 494        self.hdrDisplay = HDRviewerController(self)
 495        self.view =  view.AppView(self, HDRcontroller = self.hdrDisplay)                         
 496        self.model = model.AppModel(self)
 497
 498        self.dirName = None
 499        self.imagesName = []
 500        
 501        self.view.show()
 502    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 503
 504    def callBackSelectDir(self):
 505        """
 506        Open directory selection dialog and load HDR images.
 507        
 508        Presents a file dialog for directory selection, discovers all supported
 509        image files in the chosen directory, and loads them into the gallery.
 510        Automatically saves any pending metadata before switching directories.
 511        
 512        The method handles the complete workflow of:
 513        1. Directory selection via QFileDialog
 514        2. Saving current image metadata
 515        3. Discovering supported image formats
 516        4. Loading images into the gallery view
 517        5. Resetting HDR display to splash screen
 518        """
 519        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackSelectDir()")
 520        dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory', self.model.directory)
 521        if dirName != "":
 522            # save current images (metadata)
 523            self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
 524            # get images in the selected directory
 525            self.imagesName = []; self.imagesName = list(self.model.setDirectory(dirName))
 526
 527            self.view.imageGalleryController.setImages(self.imagesName)
 528            self.hdrDisplay.displaySplash()
 529    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 530    def callBackSave(self): 
 531        """
 532        Save current processing state and metadata.
 533        
 534        Triggers the gallery controller to save all current image metadata
 535        and processing pipeline states to persistent storage.
 536        """
 537        self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
 538    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 539    def callBackQuit(self):
 540        """
 541        Handle application shutdown with proper cleanup.
 542        
 543        Performs clean application exit by saving all metadata, closing
 544        HDR display processes, and terminating the application gracefully.
 545        Ensures no data loss during application closure.
 546        """
 547        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> AppController.callBackQuit()")
 548        self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
 549        self.hdrDisplay.close()
 550        sys.exit()
 551    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 552    def callBackDisplayHDR(self):
 553        """
 554        Display processed HDR image on external HDR monitor.
 555        
 556        Initiates the HDR display workflow by processing the currently selected
 557        image at full resolution with the complete processing pipeline, then
 558        sends the result to the external HDR display. Shows progress feedback
 559        during the compute-intensive full-resolution processing.
 560        
 561        The workflow includes:
 562        1. Retrieving selected processing pipeline
 563        2. Saving processing metadata
 564        3. Loading full-resolution source image
 565        4. Resizing to display resolution
 566        5. Applying complete processing pipeline
 567        6. Threading the computation with progress updates
 568        """
 569
 570        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackDisplayHDR()")
 571
 572        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
 573
 574        if selectedProcessPipe:
 575            self.view.statusBar().showMessage('displaying HDR image, full size image computation: start, please wait !')
 576            self.view.statusBar().repaint()
 577            # save current processpipe metada
 578            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage)
 579            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = selectedProcessPipe.toDict()
 580            originalImage.metadata.save()
 581
 582            # load full size image
 583            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
 584
 585            # turn off: autoResize
 586            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
 587            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
 588            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe)
 589
 590            # set size to display size
 591            size = pref.getDisplayShape()
 592            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.resize(),size=(None, size[1]))
 593
 594            # set image to process-pipe
 595            processpipe.setImage(img)
 596
 597            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndDisplay, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)
 598    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 599    def callBackEndDisplay(self, img):
 600        """
 601        Complete HDR display processing and send to external monitor.
 602        
 603        Finalizes the HDR display workflow by applying final processing steps
 604        and sending the image to the external HDR display. Updates the status
 605        bar to indicate completion.
 606        
 607        Args:
 608            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Processed HDR image ready for display
 609            
 610        Note:
 611            Re-enables auto-resizing after full-resolution processing and
 612            applies display-specific scaling before HDR monitor output.
 613        """
 614
 615        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackEndDisplay()")
 616
 617        # turn off: autoResize
 618        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True  
 619        
 620        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('displaying HDR image, full size image computation: done !')
 621
 622        # clip, scale
 623        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
 624        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
 625
 626        colour.write_image(img.colorData,"temp.hdr", method='Imageio') # local copy for display
 627        self.hdrDisplay.displayFile("temp.hdr")
 628    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 629    def callBackCloseDisplayHDR(self):
 630        """
 631        Close HDR display and return to splash screen.
 632        
 633        Terminates the current HDR display session and returns the external
 634        HDR monitor to the default splash screen state.
 635        """
 636        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackCloseDisplayHDR()")
 637        self.hdrDisplay.displaySplash()
 638    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 639    def callBackCompareRawEditedHDR(self):
 640        """
 641        Display side-by-side comparison of original and edited HDR images.
 642        
 643        Creates a comparison view showing the original unprocessed image
 644        alongside the current edited version. Both images are displayed
 645        at the same scale on the HDR monitor for direct visual comparison.
 646        
 647        The comparison workflow:
 648        1. Loads original unprocessed image
 649        2. Applies current processing pipeline
 650        3. Resizes both images to fit side-by-side
 651        4. Creates composite comparison image
 652        5. Displays on HDR monitor with proper scaling
 653        """
 654
 655        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackCompareOriginalInputHDR()")
 656
 657        # process real size image
 658        # get selected process pipe
 659        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
 660
 661        if selectedProcessPipe:         # check if a process pipe is selected
 662
 663            # read original image
 664            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage.path+'/'+selectedProcessPipe.originalImage.name)
 665
 666            # resize
 667            screenY, screenX = pref.getDisplayShape()
 668
 669            imgY, imgX,_ = img.shape
 670
 671            marginY = int((screenY - imgY/2)/2)
 672            marginX = int(marginY/4)
 673            imgXp = int((screenX - 3*marginX)/2)
 674            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.resize(),size=(None,imgXp))
 675            imgY, imgX, _ = img.shape
 676
 677            # original image after resize
 678            ori = copy.deepcopy(img)
 679
 680            # build process pipe from selected one them compute
 681            pp = hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe()
 682            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False   # stop autoResize
 683            params= []
 684            for p in selectedProcessPipe.processNodes: 
 685                pp.append(copy.deepcopy(p.process),paramDict=None, name=copy.deepcopy(p.name))
 686                params.append({p.name:p.params})
 687            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = params
 688            pp.setImage(img)
 689
 690            res = hdrCore.coreC.coreCcompute(img, pp)
 691            res = res.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
 692            
 693            imgYres, imgXres, _ = res.colorData.shape
 694
 695            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True    # return to autoResize
 696
 697            # make comparison image
 698            oriColorData = ori.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
 699            resColorData = res.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
 700            display = np.ones((screenY,screenX,3))*0.2
 701            marginY = int((screenY - imgY)/2)
 702            marginYres = int((screenY - imgYres)/2)
 703
 704            display[marginY:marginY+imgY, marginX:marginX+imgX,:] = oriColorData
 705            display[marginYres:marginYres+imgYres, 2*marginX+imgX:2*marginX+imgX+imgXres,:] = resColorData
 706            
 707            # save as compOrigFinal.hdr
 708            colour.write_image(display,'compOrigFinal.hdr', method='Imageio')
 709            self.hdrDisplay.displayFile('compOrigFinal.hdr')
 710    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 711    def callBackExportHDR(self):
 712        """
 713        Export single HDR image with current processing applied.
 714        
 715        Initiates the HDR export workflow for the currently selected image,
 716        allowing the user to choose the export destination and applying
 717        the complete processing pipeline at full resolution.
 718        
 719        The export process includes:
 720        1. User directory selection for output
 721        2. Full-resolution image loading
 722        3. Complete processing pipeline application
 723        4. HDR-specific encoding and scaling
 724        5. File output with appropriate metadata
 725        """
 726
 727        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackExportHDR()") 
 728
 729        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
 730
 731
 732        if selectedProcessPipe:
 733            # select dir where to save export
 734            self.dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory where to export HDR file', self.model.directory)
 735
 736            # show export message
 737            self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR image ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'), full size image computation: start, please wait !')
 738            self.view.statusBar().repaint()
 739
 740            # save current processpipe metada
 741            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage)
 742            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = selectedProcessPipe.toDict()
 743            originalImage.metadata.save()
 744
 745            # load full size image
 746            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
 747
 748            # turn off: autoResize
 749            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
 750            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
 751            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe)
 752
 753            # set image to process-pipe
 754            processpipe.setImage(img)
 755
 756            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)
 757    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 758    def callBackEndExportHDR(self, img):
 759        """
 760        Complete single HDR export and save to disk.
 761        
 762        Finalizes the HDR export process by applying final processing,
 763        saving to the selected directory, and optionally displaying
 764        the result on the HDR monitor.
 765        
 766        Args:
 767            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Processed HDR image ready for export
 768        """
 769        # turn off: autoResize
 770        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True  
 771        
 772        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR image ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'), full size image computation: done !')
 773
 774        # clip, scale
 775        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
 776        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
 777
 778        if self.dirName:
 779            pathExport = os.path.join(self.dirName, img.name[:-4]+pref.getHDRdisplay()['post']+'.hdr')
 780            img.type = hdrCore.image.imageType.HDR
 781            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None
 782            img.metadata.metadata['display'] = pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']
 783
 784            img.write(pathExport)
 785
 786        colour.write_image(img.colorData,"temp.hdr", method='Imageio') # local copy for display
 787        self.hdrDisplay.displayFile("temp.hdr")
 788    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 789    def callBackExportAllHDR(self):
 790        """
 791        Initiate batch export of all HDR images in the gallery.
 792        
 793        Starts the batch export process for all images in the current gallery,
 794        allowing users to export multiple processed HDR images with a single
 795        operation. Provides progress feedback during the batch operation.
 796        """
 797        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackExportAllHDR()")
 798
 799        self.processPipes = self.view.imageGalleryController.getProcessPipes()
 800
 801        # select dir where to save export
 802        self.dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory where to export HDR file', self.model.directory)
 803        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting '+str(len(self.processPipes))+' HDR images ... please wait')
 804        self.view.statusBar().repaint()
 805        self.imageToExport = len(self.processPipes) ; self.imageExportDone = 0
 806
 807        pp = self.processPipes[0]
 808
 809        # save current processpipe metada
 810        originalImage = copy.deepcopy(pp.originalImage)
 811        originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = pp.toDict()
 812        originalImage.metadata.save()
 813
 814        # load full size image
 815        img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
 816
 817        # turn off: autoResize
 818        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
 819        # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
 820        processpipe = copy.deepcopy(pp)
 821
 822        # set image to process-pipe
 823        processpipe.setImage(img)
 824
 825        thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndAllExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)            
 826    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 827    def callBackEndAllExportHDR(self, img):
 828        """
 829        Process single image in batch export and continue to next.
 830        
 831        Handles the completion of each individual image in the batch export
 832        process, saves the current image, updates progress, and initiates
 833        processing of the next image in the queue.
 834        
 835        Args:
 836            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Current processed HDR image in batch
 837            
 838        Note:
 839            Recursively processes all images in the batch until completion,
 840            providing progress updates throughout the operation.
 841        """
 842        # last image ?
 843        self.imageExportDone +=1
 844
 845        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR images ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'):'+str(int(100*self.imageExportDone/self.imageToExport))+'% done !')
 846
 847        # clip, scale
 848        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
 849        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
 850
 851        if self.dirName:
 852            pathExport = os.path.join(self.dirName, img.name[:-4]+pref.getHDRdisplay()['post']+'.hdr')
 853            img.type = hdrCore.image.imageType.HDR
 854            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None
 855            img.metadata.metadata['display'] = pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']
 856
 857            img.write(pathExport)
 858
 859        if self.imageExportDone == self.imageToExport :
 860            # turn off: autoResize
 861            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True
 862        else:
 863            pp = self.processPipes[self.imageExportDone]
 864
 865            if not pp:
 866                img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(self.imagesName[self.imageExportDone], thumb=True)
 867                pp = model.EditImageModel.buildProcessPipe()
 868                pp.setImage(img)                      
 869
 870
 871            # save current processpipe metada
 872            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(pp.originalImage)
 873            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = pp.toDict()
 874            originalImage.metadata.save()
 875
 876            # load full size image
 877            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
 878
 879            # turn off: autoResize
 880            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
 881            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
 882            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(pp)
 883
 884            # set image to process-pipe
 885            processpipe.setImage(img)
 886
 887            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndAllExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)            
 888# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 889# --- class MultiDockController() ----------------------------------------------------------
 890# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 891class MultiDockController():
 892    """
 893    Controller for managing multiple docked panels in the interface.
 894    
 895    This class manages the docking system that allows switching between different
 896    functional panels: EDIT (image editing), INFO (metadata/information), and
 897    MIAM (aesthetics analysis). It provides seamless transitions between
 898    different modes of interaction with the HDR images.
 899    
 900    The docking system allows users to focus on specific aspects of image
 901    processing while maintaining a consistent workflow and shared processing
 902    pipeline state across all panels.
 903    
 904    Attributes:
 905        - parent: Parent controller (typically AppController)
 906        - view (view.MultiDockView): Multi-panel view component
 907        - model: Data model (currently None, uses child controllers' models)
 908    """
 909    def __init__(self,parent=None, HDRcontroller = None):
 910        """
 911        Initialize the multi-dock controller.
 912        
 913        Args:
 914            parent: Parent controller for coordination
 915            HDRcontroller: HDR display controller for HDR preview integration
 916        """
 917        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> MultiDockController.__init__()")
 918
 919        self.parent = parent
 920        self.view = view.MultiDockView(self, HDRcontroller)
 921        self.model = None
 922    # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 923    def activateEDIT(self): 
 924        """
 925        Activate the image editing panel.
 926        
 927        Switches the interface to the image editing mode, providing access
 928        to exposure, contrast, tone curves, color editing, and other HDR
 929        processing controls.
 930        """
 931        self.switch(0)
 932    def activateINFO(self): 
 933        """
 934        Activate the image information panel.
 935        
 936        Switches the interface to the metadata and information display mode,
 937        showing EXIF data, processing history, and image properties.
 938        """
 939        self.switch(1)
 940    def activateMIAM(self):  
 941        """
 942        Activate the aesthetics analysis panel.
 943        
 944        Switches the interface to the MIAM (aesthetics) analysis mode,
 945        displaying image quality metrics, color palette analysis, and
 946        aesthetic scoring information.
 947        """
 948        self.switch(2)
 949    # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 950    def switch(self,nb):
 951        """
 952        Switch to the specified panel number.
 953        
 954        Args:
 955            nb (int): Panel index (0=EDIT, 1=INFO, 2=MIAM)
 956        """
 957        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> MultiDockController.switch()")
 958        self.view.switch(nb)
 959    # --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 960    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe): 
 961        """
 962        Set the processing pipeline for the active panel.
 963        
 964        Propagates the processing pipeline to the currently active panel,
 965        ensuring that all panels work with the same image and processing state.
 966        
 967        Args:
 968            processPipe: Processing pipeline to apply to the active panel
 969            
 970        Returns:
 971            bool: True if the pipeline was successfully set, False otherwise
 972        """
 973        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> MultiDockController.setProcessPipe(",processPipe.getImage().name,")")
 974
 975        return self.view.setProcessPipe(processPipe)
 976# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 977# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 978# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 979class EditImageController:
 980    """
 981    Controller for HDR image editing interface and processing pipeline.
 982    
 983    This class manages the comprehensive HDR image editing workflow, providing
 984    controls for exposure, contrast, tone curves, saturation, color editing,
 985    geometry transformations, and processing pipeline management. It coordinates
 986    between the editing interface and the underlying HDR processing system.
 987    
 988    The controller handles real-time preview updates, auto-adjustment algorithms,
 989    parameter synchronization, and HDR display integration for immediate visual
 990    feedback during the editing process.
 991    
 992    Attributes:
 993        - parent: Parent controller for coordination
 994        - previewHDR (bool): Enable/disable HDR preview updates
 995        - controllerHDR: HDR display controller for real-time preview
 996        - view (view.EditImageView): Image editing interface view
 997        - model (model.EditImageModel): Image editing data model and processing
 998    """
 999
1000    def __init__(self, parent=None, HDRcontroller = None):
1001        """
1002        Initialize the image editing controller.
1003        
1004        Args:
1005            parent: Parent controller for coordination
1006            HDRcontroller: HDR display controller for real-time preview
1007        """
1008        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> EditImageController.__init__(",")")
1009
1010        self.parent = parent
1011
1012        self.previewHDR = True
1013        self.controllerHDR = HDRcontroller
1014
1015        self.view = view.EditImageView(self)
1016        self.model = model.EditImageModel(self)
1017    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1018    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe): 
1019        """
1020        Set the processing pipeline for editing.
1021        
1022        Configures the editing interface to work with the specified processing
1023        pipeline, updating all controls and displays to reflect the current
1024        processing state.
1025        
1026        Args:
1027            processPipe: Processing pipeline containing image and processing nodes
1028            
1029        Returns:
1030            bool: True if the pipeline was successfully set, False otherwise
1031        """
1032        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> EditImageController.setProcessPipe(",")")
1033
1034        if self.model.setProcessPipe(processPipe):
1035
1036            # update view
1037            self.view.setProcessPipe(processPipe)
1038            self.view.imageWidgetController.setImage(processPipe.getImage())
1039
1040            self.view.plotToneCurve()
1041
1042            # update hdr viewer
1043            self.controllerHDR.displaySplash()
1044
1045            return True
1046        else:
1047            return False
1048    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1049    def getProcessPipe(self) : 
1050        """
1051        Get the current processing pipeline.
1052        
1053        Returns:
1054            ProcessPipe: Current processing pipeline with all applied operations
1055        """
1056        return self.model.getProcessPipe()
1057    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1058    def buildView(self,processPipe=None):
1059        """
1060        Build or rebuild the editing interface view.
1061        
1062        Reconstructs the editing interface, typically called when switching
1063        between different panels or when the interface needs to be refreshed.
1064        
1065        Args:
1066            processPipe: Optional processing pipeline to set during build
1067        """
1068        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> EditImageController.buildView(",")")
1069
1070        """ called when MultiDockController recall a controller/view """
1071        self.view = view.EditImageView(self, build=True)
1072        if processPipe: self.setProcessPipe(processPipe)
1073    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1074    def autoExposure(self): 
1075        """
1076        Calculate and apply optimal exposure automatically.
1077        
1078        Uses histogram analysis to determine the optimal exposure value that
1079        maximizes dynamic range usage without clipping, then applies this
1080        exposure and updates the interface controls.
1081        """
1082        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> EditImageController.autoExposure(",")")
1083        if self.model.processpipe:
1084      
1085            img = self.model.autoExposure()
1086
1087            # update view with computed EV
1088            paramDict = self.model.getEV()
1089            self.view.exposure.setValue(paramDict['EV'])
1090
1091            qPixmap =  self.view.setImage(img)
1092            self.parent.controller.parent.controller.view.imageGalleryController.setProcessPipeWidgetQPixmap(qPixmap)
1093    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1094    def changeExposure(self,value):
1095        """
1096        Adjust image exposure by specified EV value.
1097        
1098        Args:
1099            value (float): Exposure adjustment in EV stops (positive = brighter)
1100        """
1101        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> EditImageController.changeExposure(",value,")")
1102        if self.model.processpipe: self.model.changeExposure(value)
1103    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1104    def changeContrast(self,value):
1105        """
1106        Adjust image contrast by specified amount.
1107        
1108        Args:
1109            value (float): Contrast adjustment value (positive = more contrast)
1110        """
1111        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> EditImageController.changeContrast(",value,")")
1112        if self.model.processpipe: self.model.changeContrast(value)
1113    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1114    def changeToneCurve(self,controlPoints):
1115        """
1116        Modify tone curve using B-spline control points.
1117        
1118        Args:
1119            controlPoints (dict): Control points defining the tone curve shape
1120                                 with keys like 'shadows', 'highlights', etc.
1121        """
1122        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> EditImageController.changeToneCurve("")")
1123        if self.model.processpipe: self.model.changeToneCurve(controlPoints)
1124    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1125    def changeLightnessMask(self, maskValues):
1126        """
1127        Configure lightness-based masking for tone range selection.
1128        
1129        Args:
1130            maskValues (dict): Mask configuration for different tone ranges
1131                              (shadows, blacks, mediums, whites, highlights)
1132        """
1133        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> EditImageController.changeLightnessMask(",maskValues,")")
1134        if self.model.processpipe: self.model.changeLightnessMask(maskValues)
1135    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1136    def changeSaturation(self,value):
1137        """
1138        Adjust color saturation globally.
1139        
1140        Args:
1141            value (float): Saturation adjustment value (positive = more saturated)
1142        """
1143        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> EditImageController.changeSaturation(",value,")")
1144        if self.model.processpipe: self.model.changeSaturation(value)
1145    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1146    def changeColorEditor(self,values, idName):
1147        """
1148        Apply selective color editing to specific color ranges.
1149        
1150        Args:
1151            values (dict): Color editing parameters including selection criteria
1152                          and editing adjustments (hue, saturation, exposure, etc.)
1153            idName (str): Identifier for the color editor instance
1154        """
1155        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> EditImageController.changeColorEditor(",values,")")
1156        if self.model.processpipe: self.model.changeColorEditor(values, idName)
1157    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1158    def changeGeometry(self,values):
1159        """
1160        Apply geometric transformations (crop, rotation, etc.).
1161        
1162        Args:
1163            values (dict): Geometry parameters including crop ratios,
1164                          rotation angles, and positioning adjustments
1165        """
1166        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> EditImageController.changeGeometry(",values,")")
1167        if self.model.processpipe: self.model.changeGeometry(values)
1168    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1169    def updateImage(self,imgTM):
1170        """
1171        Handle processing completion and update displays.
1172        
1173        Called when the processing pipeline computation is complete, updates
1174        the interface display, gallery thumbnail, and optionally triggers
1175        HDR preview updates.
1176        
1177        Args:
1178            imgTM (hdrCore.image.Image): Tone-mapped image for GUI display
1179        """
1180        qPixmap =  self.view.setImage(imgTM)
1181        self.parent.controller.parent.controller.view.imageGalleryController.setProcessPipeWidgetQPixmap(qPixmap)
1182        self.view.plotToneCurve()
1183
1184        # if aesthetics model > notify required update
1185
1186
1187        if self.previewHDR and self.model.autoPreviewHDR:
1188            self.controllerHDR.callBackUpdate()

1192class ImageInfoController:
1193    """

1198    view of all technical information associated with HDR images.
1199

1201    visibility, and metadata modification workflows while maintaining
1202    data integrity throughout the editing process.
1203    
1204    Attributes:
1205        - parent: Parent controller for coordination
1206        - view (view.ImageInfoView): Metadata display interface

1277class AdvanceSliderController():
1278    """
1279    Controller for advanced slider controls with auto-adjustment capabilities.
1280    
1281    This class provides enhanced slider functionality with features like automatic
1282    value calculation, reset capabilities, and custom step sizes. It's used throughout
1283    the HDR editing interface for precise parameter control with additional
1284    automation features.
1285    
1286    The advanced slider combines manual adjustment with intelligent auto-adjustment
1287    algorithms, allowing users to fine-tune parameters manually or rely on
1288    automatic optimization algorithms.
1289    
1290    Attributes:
1291        - parent: Parent controller for coordination
1292        - view (view.AdvanceSliderView): Slider interface component
1293        - model (model.AdvanceSliderModel): Slider data model
1294        - step (float): Step size for slider increments
1295        - defaultValue (float): Default/reset value for the slider
1296        - range (tuple): Minimum and maximum values for the slider
1297        - callBackActive (bool): Enable/disable callback processing
1298        - callBackValueChange: Callback function for value changes
1299        - callBackAutoPush: Callback function for auto-adjustment
1300    """
1301    def __init__(self, parent,name, defaultValue, range, step,callBackValueChange=None,callBackAutoPush= None):
1302        """
1303        Initialize the advanced slider controller.
1304        
1305        Args:
1306            parent: Parent controller for coordination
1307            name (str): Display name for the slider
1308            defaultValue (float): Default value for reset functionality
1309            range (tuple): (min, max) range for slider values
1310            step (float): Step size for value increments
1311            callBackValueChange: Callback function for value changes
1312            callBackAutoPush: Callback function for auto-adjustment
1313        """
1314        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AdvanceSliderController.__init__(",") ")
1315        self.parent = parent
1316
1317        self.view = view.AdvanceSliderView(self,  name, defaultValue, range, step)
1318        self.model = model.AdvanceSliderModel(self, value=defaultValue)
1319
1320        self.step = step
1321        self.defaultValue = defaultValue
1322        self.range = range
1323
1324        self.callBackActive = True
1325        self.callBackValueChange = callBackValueChange
1326        self.callBackAutoPush = callBackAutoPush
1327    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1328    def sliderChange(self):
1329        """
1330        Handle manual slider value changes.
1331        
1332        Processes slider movement events, updates the model and display,
1333        and triggers the value change callback if active. Converts slider
1334        position to actual value using the configured step size.
1335        """
1336
1337        value = self.view.slider.value()*self.step
1338
1339        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> AdvanceSliderController.sliderChange(",value,")[callBackActive:",self.callBackActive,"] ")
1340
1341        self.model.value = value
1342        self.view.editValue.setText(str(value))
1343        if self.callBackActive and self.callBackValueChange: self.callBackValueChange(value)
1344    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1345    def setValue(self, value, callBackActive = True):
1346        """
1347        Set slider value programmatically.
1348        
1349        Updates the slider position and display to reflect the specified value,
1350        with optional callback suppression for initialization or batch updates.
1351        
1352        Args:
1353            value (float): New value to set
1354            callBackActive (bool, optional): Whether to trigger callbacks (default: True)
1355        """
1356        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AdvanceSliderController.setValue(",value,") ")
1357
1358        """ set value value in 'model' range"""
1359        self.callBackActive = callBackActive
1360        self.view.slider.setValue(int(value/self.step))
1361        self.view.editValue.setText(str(value))
1362        self.model.setValue(int(value))
1363
1364        self.callBackActive = True
1365    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1366    def reset(self):
1367        """
1368        Reset slider to its default value.
1369        
1370        Restores the slider to its initial default value and triggers
1371        the value change callback to update dependent processing.
1372        """
1373        if pref.verbose : print(" [CB] >> AdvanceSliderController.reset(",") ")
1374
1375        self.setValue(self.defaultValue,callBackActive = False)
1376        if self.callBackValueChange: self.callBackValueChange(self.defaultValue)
1377    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1378    def auto(self):
1379        """
1380        Trigger automatic value calculation.
1381        
1382        Initiates the auto-adjustment algorithm by calling the registered
1383        auto-push callback, which typically analyzes the image and sets
1384        an optimal value automatically.
1385        """
1386        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> AdvanceSliderController.auto(",") ")
1387
1388        if self.callBackAutoPush: self.callBackAutoPush()
1389# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1390# --- class AdvanceSliderController --------------------------------------------------------
1391# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1392class ToneCurveController():
1393    """
1394    Controller for tone curve editing with B-spline interpolation.
1395    
1396    This class manages the tone curve editing interface, allowing users to adjust
1397    the luminance mapping through control points that define a smooth B-spline curve.
1398    It includes automatic curve generation using machine learning, histogram overlay
1399    display, and comprehensive curve visualization options.
1400    
1401    The tone curve is a fundamental HDR processing tool that maps input luminance
1402    values to output values, effectively controlling the overall tone mapping
1403    and local contrast of the image.
1404    
1405    Attributes:
1406        - parent: Parent controller for coordination
1407        - model (model.ToneCurveModel): Tone curve mathematical model
1408        - view (view.ToneCurveView): Curve editing interface
1409        - callBackActive (bool): Enable/disable callback processing
1410        - showInput (bool): Display input image histogram
1411        - showbefore (bool): Display pre-curve histogram
1412        - showAfter (bool): Display post-curve histogram  
1413        - showOutput (bool): Display final output histogram
1414        - weightFile (str): Machine learning model file for auto-curve
1415        - networkModel: PyTorch neural network for automatic curve generation
1416    """
1417    def __init__(self, parent):
1418        """
1419        Initialize the tone curve controller.
1420        
1421        Args:
1422            parent: Parent controller for coordination and image access
1423        """
1424
1425        self.parent = parent
1426        self.model = model.ToneCurveModel()
1427        self.view = view.ToneCurveView(self)
1428        self.callBackActive = True
1429
1430        # tone curve display control
1431        self.showInput =False
1432        self.showbefore = False
1433        self.showAfter = False
1434        self.showOutput = True
1435
1436        # zj add semi-auto curve
1437        # machine learning network and weight file 
1438        self.weightFile = 'MSESig505_0419.pth'
1439        self.networkModel = None  
1440    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1441    def sliderChange(self, key, value):
1442        """
1443        Handle tone curve control point adjustments.
1444        
1445        Processes changes to individual control points (shadows, blacks, mediums,
1446        whites, highlights), updates the B-spline curve, and triggers processing
1447        pipeline updates. Auto-scales related control points to maintain curve smoothness.
1448        
1449        Args:
1450            key (str): Control point identifier ('shadows', 'blacks', etc.)
1451            value (float): New value for the control point
1452        """
1453        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> ToneCurveController.sliderChange(",key,",",value,")[callBackActive:",self.callBackActive,"] ")
1454
1455        if self.callBackActive:
1456            newValues = self.model.setValue(key, value, autoScale = False)
1457            self.parent.controller.changeToneCurve(newValues) 
1458  
1459            points = self.model.evaluate()
1460
1461            self.callBackActive =  False
1462
1463            self.view.sliderShadows.setValue(int(newValues["shadows"][1]))
1464            self.view.editShadows.setText(str(newValues["shadows"][1]))
1465
1466            self.view.sliderBlacks.setValue(int(newValues["blacks"][1]))
1467            self.view.editBlacks.setText(str(newValues["blacks"][1]))
1468
1469            self.view.sliderMediums.setValue(int(newValues["mediums"][1]))
1470            self.view.editMediums.setText(str(newValues["mediums"][1]))
1471
1472            self.view.sliderWhites.setValue(int(newValues["whites"][1]))
1473            self.view.editWhites.setText(str(newValues["whites"][1]))
1474
1475            self.view.sliderHighlights.setValue(int(newValues["highlights"][1]))
1476            self.view.editHighlights.setText(str(newValues["highlights"][1]))
1477
1478            self.callBackActive =  True
1479    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1480    def setValues(self, valuesDict,callBackActive = False):
1481        """
1482        Set all tone curve control points programmatically.
1483        
1484        Updates all control points simultaneously and refreshes the interface
1485        to reflect the new curve shape. Typically used for loading saved
1486        curves or applying automatic curve calculations.
1487        
1488        Args:
1489            valuesDict (dict): Dictionary containing all control point values
1490                             with keys like 'shadows', 'blacks', 'mediums', etc.
1491            callBackActive (bool, optional): Whether to trigger callbacks (default: False)
1492        """
1493        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ToneCurveController.setValue(",valuesDict,") ")
1494
1495        self.callBackActive = callBackActive
1496
1497        self.model.setValues(valuesDict)
1498        points = self.model.evaluate()
1499
1500        self.view.sliderShadows.setValue(int(valuesDict["shadows"][1]))
1501        self.view.editShadows.setText(str(valuesDict["shadows"][1]))
1502
1503        self.view.sliderBlacks.setValue(int(valuesDict["blacks"][1]))
1504        self.view.editBlacks.setText(str(valuesDict["blacks"][1]))
1505
1506        self.view.sliderMediums.setValue(int(valuesDict["mediums"][1]))
1507        self.view.editMediums.setText(str(valuesDict["mediums"][1]))
1508
1509        self.view.sliderWhites.setValue(int(valuesDict["whites"][1]))
1510        self.view.editWhites.setText(str(valuesDict["whites"][1]))
1511
1512        self.view.sliderHighlights.setValue(int(valuesDict["highlights"][1]))
1513        self.view.editHighlights.setText(str(valuesDict["highlights"][1]))
1514
1515        self.callBackActive = True
1516    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------     
1517    # zj add for semi-auto curve begin
1518    def autoCurve(self):
1519        """
1520        Generate tone curve automatically using machine learning analysis.
1521        
1522        Analyzes the current image's histogram distribution and uses a trained
1523        neural network to predict optimal control point values for enhanced
1524        image appearance. The ML model considers luminance distribution patterns
1525        to suggest appropriate tone mapping.
1526        
1527        The process involves:
1528        1. Computing cumulative histogram of image luminance
1529        2. Feeding histogram to trained neural network
1530        3. Predicting optimal control point values
1531        4. Applying the generated curve to the processing pipeline
1532        """
1533        processPipe = self.parent.controller.model.getProcessPipe()
1534        if processPipe != None :
1535            idExposure = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
1536            bins = np.linspace(0,1,50+1)
1537
1538            imageBeforeColorData = processPipe.processNodes[idExposure-1].outputImage.colorData
1539            imageBeforeColorData[imageBeforeColorData>1]=1
1540            imageBeforeY = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageBeforeColorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1541            nphistBefore  = np.histogram(imageBeforeY, bins)[0]
1542            nphistBefore  = nphistBefore/np.amax(nphistBefore)
1543
1544            npImgHistCumuNorm = np.empty_like(nphistBefore)
1545            npImgHistCumu = np.cumsum(nphistBefore)
1546            npImgHistCumuNorm = npImgHistCumu/np.max(npImgHistCumu)
1547            
1548            #predict keypoint value
1549            if self.networkModel == None:
1550                self.networkModel = Net(50,5)
1551                self.networkModel.load_state_dict(torch.load(self.weightFile))
1552                self.networkModel.eval()
1553
1554            with torch.no_grad():
1555                x = Variable(torch.FloatTensor([npImgHistCumuNorm.tolist(),]), requires_grad=True)
1556                y_predict = self.networkModel(x)
1557
1558            kpc = (y_predict[0]*100).tolist() 
1559            kpcDict = {'start':[0.0,0.0], 'shadows': [10.0,int(kpc[0])], 'blacks': [30.0,int(kpc[1])], 'mediums': [50.0,int(kpc[2])], 'whites': [70.0,int(kpc[3])], 'highlights': [90.0,int(kpc[4])], 'end': [100.0,100.0]}
1560            self.setValues(kpcDict,callBackActive = True)
1561            self.parent.controller.changeToneCurve(kpcDict) 
1562     
1563    # zj add for semi-auto curve end   
1564
1565    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1566    def reset(self, key):
1567        """
1568        Reset specific control point to its default value.
1569        
1570        Restores a single control point to its default position and updates
1571        the curve accordingly. Useful for correcting individual control
1572        points without affecting the entire curve.
1573        
1574        Args:
1575            key (str): Control point to reset ('shadows', 'blacks', etc.)
1576        """
1577        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ToneCurveController.reset(",key,") ")
1578
1579        valuesDefault = copy.deepcopy(self.model.default[key])[1]
1580        controls = self.model.setValue(key, valuesDefault)
1581        self.setValues(controls,callBackActive = False)
1582
1583        self.parent.controller.changeToneCurve(controls) 
1584    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1585    def plotCurve(self):
1586        """
1587        Display tone curve and histogram overlays.
1588        
1589        Renders the current tone curve along with optional histogram overlays
1590        for input, pre-processing, post-processing, and output stages. Provides
1591        visual feedback on how the curve affects the image's tonal distribution.
1592        
1593        The plot includes:
1594        - Grid lines for reference
1595        - Tone curve visualization
1596        - Control points markers
1597        - Optional histogram overlays for different processing stages
1598        """
1599        try:
1600            self.view.curve.plot([0,100],[0,100],'r--', clear=True)
1601            self.view.curve.plot([20,20],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
1602            self.view.curve.plot([40,40],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
1603            self.view.curve.plot([60,60],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
1604            self.view.curve.plot([80,80],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
1605
1606            processPipe = self.parent.controller.model.getProcessPipe()
1607            idExposure = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
1608
1609            bins = np.linspace(0,1,50+1)
1610
1611            if self.showInput:
1612                imageInput = copy.deepcopy(processPipe.getInputImage())
1613                if imageInput.linear: imageInputColorData =colour.cctf_encoding(imageInput.colorData, function='sRGB')
1614                else: imageInputColorData = imageInput.colorData
1615                imageInputColorData[imageInputColorData>1]=1
1616                imageInputY = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageInputColorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1617                nphistInput  = np.histogram(imageInputY, bins)[0]
1618                nphistInput  = nphistInput/np.amax(nphistInput)
1619                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistInput*100,'k--',  clear=False)
1620
1621            if self.showbefore:
1622                imageBeforeColorData = processPipe.processNodes[idExposure-1].outputImage.colorData
1623                imageBeforeColorData[imageBeforeColorData>1]=1
1624                imageBeforeY = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageBeforeColorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1625                nphistBefore  = np.histogram(imageBeforeY, bins)[0]
1626                nphistBefore  = nphistBefore/np.amax(nphistBefore)
1627                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistBefore*100,'b--',  clear=False)
1628
1629            if self.showAfter:
1630                imageAftercolorData = processPipe.processNodes[idExposure].outputImage.colorData
1631                imageAftercolorData[imageAftercolorData>1]=1
1632                imageAfterY  = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageAftercolorData,  apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1633                nphistAfter   = np.histogram(imageAfterY, bins)[0]
1634                nphistAfter   =nphistAfter/np.amax(nphistAfter)
1635                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistAfter*100,'b',     clear=False)
1636
1637            if self.showOutput:
1638                imageAftercolorData = processPipe.getImage(toneMap=True).colorData
1639                imageAftercolorData[imageAftercolorData>1]=1
1640                imageAfterY  = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageAftercolorData,  apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1641                nphistAfter   = np.histogram(imageAfterY, bins)[0]
1642                nphistAfter   =nphistAfter/np.amax(nphistAfter)
1643                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistAfter*100,'b',     clear=False)
1644
1645            controlPointCoordinates= np.asarray(list(self.model.control.values()))
1646            self.view.curve.plot(controlPointCoordinates[1:-1,0],controlPointCoordinates[1:-1,1],'ro', clear=False)
1647            points = np.asarray(self.model.curve.evalpts)
1648            x = points[:,0]
1649            self.view.curve.plot(points[x<100,0],points[x<100,1],'r',clear=False)
1650        except:
1651            time.sleep(0.5)
1652            self.plotCurve()
1653# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

1656class LightnessMaskController():
1657    """
1658    Controller for lightness-based masking and tone range selection.
1659    
1660    This class manages the lightness mask interface, allowing users to selectively
1661    target specific tonal ranges (shadows, blacks, mediums, whites, highlights) 
1662    for localized editing operations. The masking system enables precise control
1663    over HDR processing by limiting effects to specific luminance ranges.
1664    
1665    Lightness masking is essential for HDR editing as it allows photographers
1666    to adjust different tonal ranges independently, creating more natural and
1667    visually pleasing results.
1668    
1669    Attributes:
1670        - parent: Parent controller for coordination
1671        - model (model.LightnessMaskModel): Lightness mask data model
1672        - view (view.LightnessMaskView): Mask selection interface
1673        - callBackActive (bool): Enable/disable callback processing
1674    """
1675    def __init__(self, parent):
1676        """
1677        Initialize the lightness mask controller.
1678        
1679        Args:
1680            parent: Parent controller for coordination and processing pipeline access
1681        """
1682        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> MaskLightnessController.__init__(",")")
1683
1684        self.parent= parent
1685        self.model = model.LightnessMaskModel(self)
1686        self.view = view.LightnessMaskView(self)
1687
1688        self.callBackActive = True
1689    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1690    def maskChange(self,key, on_off):
1691        """
1692        Handle mask enable/disable for specific tone ranges.
1693        
1694        Processes user interactions with mask checkboxes, updating the mask
1695        state for the specified tonal range and triggering processing updates
1696        to apply the mask changes.
1697        
1698        Args:
1699            key (str): Tone range identifier ('shadows', 'blacks', 'mediums', 
1700                      'whites', 'highlights')
1701            on_off (bool): Enable (True) or disable (False) the mask for this range
1702        """
1703        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> MaskLightnessController.maskChange(",key,",",on_off,")[callBackActive:",self.callBackActive,"] ")
1704
1705        maskState = self.model.maskChange(key, on_off)  
1706        self.parent.controller.changeLightnessMask(maskState) 
1707    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1708    def setValues(self, values,callBackActive = False):
1709        """
1710        Set all mask states programmatically.
1711        
1712        Updates all tone range masks simultaneously and refreshes the interface
1713        to reflect the new mask configuration. Used for loading saved mask
1714        states or batch mask updates.
1715        
1716        Args:
1717            values (dict): Dictionary containing mask states for all tone ranges
1718                          with boolean values for each range
1719            callBackActive (bool, optional): Whether to trigger callbacks (default: False)
1720        """
1721        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> LightnessMaskController.setValue(",values,") ")
1722
1723        self.callBackActive = callBackActive
1724
1725        self.model.setValues(values)
1726
1727        self.view.checkboxShadows.setChecked(values["shadows"])
1728        self.view.checkboxBlacks.setChecked(values["blacks"])
1729        self.view.checkboxMediums.setChecked(values["mediums"])
1730        self.view.checkboxWhites.setChecked(values["whites"])
1731        self.view.checkboxHighlights.setChecked(values["highlights"])   
1732
1733        self.callBackActive = True
