1737class HDRviewerController():
1738    """
1739    Controller for external HDR display and viewer management.
1740    
1741    This class manages the external HDR display functionality, coordinating with
1742    HDR-capable monitors to show processed images at their full dynamic range.
1743    It handles display process management, image comparison modes, auto-preview
1744    functionality, and HDR display scaling.
1745    
1746    The HDR viewer enables real-time preview of processing results on calibrated
1747    HDR displays, providing immediate visual feedback for professional HDR
1748    image editing workflows.
1749    
1750    Attributes:
1751        - parent: Parent controller for coordination
1752        - model (model.HDRviewerModel): HDR display data model
1753        - view: View component (set externally)
1754        - viewerProcess: External HDR viewer process handle
1755    """
1756    def __init__(self, parent):
1757        """
1758        Initialize the HDR viewer controller.
1759        
1760        Args:
1761            parent: Parent controller for coordination and image access
1762        """
1763        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> HDRviewerController.__init__(",")")
1764
1765        self.parent= parent
1766        self.model = model.HDRviewerModel(self)
1767        self.view = None 
1768
1769        self.viewerProcess = None
1770
1771        self.displaySplash()
1772
1773    def setView(self, view): 
1774        """
1775        Set the view component for the HDR viewer.
1776        
1777        Args:
1778            view: View component to associate with this controller
1779        """
1780        self.view = view
1781
1782    def callBackUpdate(self):
1783        """
1784        Update HDR display with the current processed image.
1785        
1786        Retrieves the currently selected processing pipeline, processes the
1787        image without tone mapping (preserving HDR values), and displays
1788        the result on the HDR monitor. Updates the current image reference
1789        for comparison operations.
1790        """
1791        selectedProcessPipe = self.parent.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
1792        img = selectedProcessPipe.getImage(toneMap = False)
1793        self.displayIMG(img)
1794        self.model.currentIMG = img
1795
1796    def callBackAuto(self,on_off):
1797        """
1798        Toggle automatic HDR preview updates.
1799        
1800        Enables or disables automatic HDR display updates when processing
1801        parameters change, allowing for real-time preview on HDR monitors.
1802        
1803        Args:
1804            on_off (bool): Enable (True) or disable (False) auto-preview
1805        """
1806        self.parent.view.dock.view.childControllers[0].model.autoPreviewHDR = on_off
1807
1808    def callBackCompare(self):
1809        """
1810        Display before/after comparison on HDR monitor.
1811        
1812        Creates a side-by-side comparison showing the previous processing
1813        result alongside the current result, enabling visual comparison
1814        of processing changes. If no previous result exists, updates
1815        with current processing.
1816        """
1817        if self.model.currentIMG:
1818            old = self.model.currentIMG
1819            old = old.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
1820
1821            sp = self.parent.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
1822            img = sp.getImage(toneMap = False)
1823            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
1824
1825
1826            h1, w1, _ = old.colorData.shape
1827            h2, w2, _ = img.colorData.shape
1828            hD, wD = self.model.displayModel['shape']
1829            hM = int((hD - max(h1,h2))/2)
1830            wM = int((wD - (w1+w2))/3)
1831            back =  np.ones((hD,wD,3))*0.2
1832
1833            back[hM:hM+h1,wM:wM+w1,:] = old.colorData*self.model.displayModel['scaling']
1834            back[hM:hM+h2,2*wM+w1:2*wM+w1+w2,:] = img.colorData*self.model.displayModel['scaling']
1835
1836            # save as temp.hdr
1837            colour.write_image(back,'temp.hdr', method='Imageio')
1838            self.displayFile('temp.hdr')
1839
1840            self.model.currentIMG = img
1841        else: self.callBackUpdate()
1842
1843    def displayFile(self, HDRfilename):
1844        """
1845        Display HDR file on external HDR monitor.
1846        
1847        Launches or updates the external HDR viewer process to display the
1848        specified HDR file. Handles process management and error recovery
1849        for reliable HDR display functionality.
1850        
1851        Args:
1852            HDRfilename (str): Path to HDR file to display
1853            
1854        Note:
1855            Uses HDRImageViewer.exe for Windows-based HDR display.
1856            Includes automatic process restart if initial launch fails.
1857        """
1858
1859         # check that no current display process already open
1860        if self.viewerProcess:
1861            # the display HDR process is already running
1862            # close current
1863            subprocess.run(['taskkill', '/F', '/T', '/IM', "HDRImageViewer*"],capture_output=False)
1864            time.sleep(0.05)
1865        # run display HDR process
1866        self.viewerProcess = subprocess.Popen(["HDRImageViewer.exe","-f", "-input:"+HDRfilename, "-f", "-h"], shell=True)
1867        time.sleep(0.10)
1868        psData = subprocess.run(['tasklist'], capture_output=True, universal_newlines=True).stdout
1869        if not 'HDRImageViewer' in psData: 
1870            # re-run display HDR process
1871            self.viewerProcess = subprocess.Popen(["HDRImageViewer.exe","-f", "-input:"+HDRfilename, "-f", "-h"], shell=True)
1872
1873    def displayIMG(self, img):
1874        """
1875        Display processed image on HDR monitor.
1876        
1877        Processes and displays a uHDR Image object on the external HDR monitor,
1878        applying appropriate clipping, scaling, and centering for optimal
1879        HDR display presentation.
1880        
1881        Args:
1882            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Processed HDR image to display
1883        """
1884        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
1885        print(self.model.scaling())
1886        colorData = img.colorData*self.model.displayModel['scaling']
1887
1888        h,w, _ = colorData.shape
1889        hD, wD = self.model.displayModel['shape']
1890
1891        if w<wD:
1892            back = np.ones((hD,wD,3))*0.2
1893            marginW = int((wD-w)/2)
1894            marginH = int((hD-h)/2)
1895
1896            back[marginH:marginH+h,marginW:marginW+w,:]=colorData
1897
1898        # save as temp.hdr
1899        colour.write_image(back,'temp.hdr', method='Imageio')
1900        self.displayFile('temp.hdr')
1901
1902    def displaySplash(self):
1903        """
1904        Display default splash screen on HDR monitor.
1905        
1906        Shows the default splash screen image, typically used when no
1907        specific image is being displayed or during application startup.
1908        Clears the current image reference.
1909        """
1910        self.model.currentIMG = None
1911        self.displayFile('grey.hdr')
1912
1913    def close(self):
1914        """
1915        Close HDR viewer and terminate display process.
1916        
1917        Safely terminates the external HDR viewer process and cleans up
1918        resources. Should be called during application shutdown or when
1919        HDR display is no longer needed.
1920        """
1921        # check that no current display process already open
1922        if self.viewerProcess:
1923            # the display HDR process is already running
1924            # close current
1925            subprocess.run(['taskkill', '/F', '/T', '/IM', "HDRImageViewer*"],capture_output=False)
1926            self.viewerProcess = None

1930class LchColorSelectorController:

1936    selection and modification. It enables photographers to selectively edit
1937    specific color ranges with professional-grade precision.
1938

1940    allowing for targeted adjustments to specific colors while preserving the
1941    overall image integrity. This is essential for professional HDR color grading.
1942

1944        - parent: Parent controller for coordination

2050    def setValues(self, values, callBackActive = False):
2051        """
2052        Set all color editing parameters programmatically.
2053        
2054        Updates all selection and editing controls simultaneously, typically
2055        used when loading saved color editing presets or initializing the
2056        interface with specific values.
2057        
2058        Args:
2059            values (dict): Complete color editing configuration including
2060                          selection ranges and editing parameters
2061            callBackActive (bool, optional): Whether to trigger callbacks (default: False)
2062        """
2063        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> LchColorSelectorController.setValue(",values,") ")
2064
2065        self.callBackActive = callBackActive
2066        # slider hue selection
2067        v = values['selection']['hue'] if 'hue' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,360)
2068        self.view.sliderHueMin.setValue(int(v[0]))
2069        self.view.sliderHueMax.setValue(int(v[1]))
2070
2071        # slider chroma selection
2072        v = values['selection']['chroma'] if 'chroma' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,100)
2073        self.view.sliderChromaMin.setValue(int(v[0]))
2074        self.view.sliderChromaMax.setValue(int(v[1]))
2075
2076        # slider lightness
2077        v = values['selection']['lightness'] if 'lightness' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,100)
2078        self.view.sliderLightMin.setValue(int(v[0]*3))
2079        self.view.sliderLightMax.setValue(int(v[1]*3))
2080
2081        # hue shift editor
2082        v = values['edit']['hue'] if 'hue' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
2083        self.view.sliderHueShift.setValue(int(v))
2084        self.view.valueHueShift.setText(str(v)) 
2085
2086        # exposure editor
2087        v : int = values['edit']['exposure'] if 'exposure' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
2088        self.view.sliderExposure.setValue(int(v*30))
2089        self.view.valueExposure.setText(str(v)) 
2090
2091        # contrast editor
2092        v : int = values['edit']['contrast'] if 'contrast' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
2093        self.view.sliderContrast.setValue(int(v))
2094        self.view.valueContrast.setText(str(v))  
2095
2096        # saturation editor
2097        v : int = values['edit']['saturation'] if 'saturation' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
2098        self.view.sliderSaturation.setValue(int(v))
2099        self.view.valueSaturation.setText(str(v))  
2100
2101        # mask
2102        v : bool = values['mask'] if 'mask' in values.keys() else False
2103        self.view.checkboxMask.setChecked(values['mask'])             
2104
2105        self.model.setValues(values)
2106
2107        self.callBackActive = True
2108

2110    def resetSelection(self): 
2111        """
2112        Reset color selection parameters to defaults.
2113

2116        starting fresh color selections.
2117        """
2118        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> LchColorSelectorController.resetSelection(",") ")
2119
2120        default = copy.deepcopy(self.model.default)
2121        current = copy.deepcopy(self.model.getValues())
2122        
2123        current['selection'] = default['selection']
2124
2125        self.setValues(current,callBackActive = True)
2126        self.callBackActive = True
2127

2129        """
2130        Reset editing parameters to defaults.
2131

2134        Useful for clearing applied adjustments.
2135        """
2136        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> LchColorSelectorController.resetEdit(",") ")
2137
2138        default = copy.deepcopy(self.model.default)
2139        current = copy.deepcopy(self.model.getValues())
2140        
2141        current['edit'] = default['edit']
2142
2143        self.setValues(current,callBackActive = True)
2144        self.callBackActive = True

2148class GeometryController:
2149    """
2150    Controller for geometric transformations and image adjustments.
2151    
2152    This class manages geometric processing controls including cropping adjustments,
2153    rotation, and spatial positioning. It provides essential tools for correcting
2154    perspective issues, adjusting composition, and applying geometric corrections
2155    to HDR images while preserving image quality.
2156    
2157    The geometry controller handles precision adjustments that are critical for
2158    professional HDR photography, especially when correcting architectural
2159    photography or adjusting horizon lines.
2160    
2161    Attributes:
2162        - parent: Parent controller for coordination
2163        - model (model.GeometryModel): Geometric transformation data model
2164        - view (view.GeometryView): Geometry adjustment interface
2165        - callBackActive (bool): Enable/disable callback processing
2166    """
2167    def __init__(self, parent ):
2168        """
2169        Initialize the geometry controller.
2170        
2171        Args:
2172            parent: Parent controller for coordination and processing pipeline access
2173        """
2174        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> GeometryController.__init__(",") ")
2175        self.parent = parent
2176        self.model =    model.GeometryModel(self)
2177        self.view =     view.GeometryView(self)
2178
2179        self.callBackActive = True
2180    # callbacks
2181    def sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustementChange(self,v):
2182        """
2183        Handle vertical cropping position adjustments.
2184        
2185        Adjusts the vertical position of the crop area, allowing users to
2186        reframe the image vertically while maintaining the aspect ratio.
2187        
2188        Args:
2189            v (float): Vertical adjustment value (typically -100 to +100)
2190        """
2191        values = self.model.setCroppingVerticalAdjustement(v)
2192        if self.callBackActive : self.parent.controller.changeGeometry(values)
2193
2194    def sliderRotationChange(self,v):
2195        """
2196        Handle rotation angle adjustments.
2197        
2198        Adjusts the image rotation angle for correcting tilted horizons or
2199        perspective issues. Rotation is applied with automatic cropping to
2200        maintain rectangular output.
2201        
2202        Args:
2203            v (float): Rotation angle in degrees
2204        """
2205        values = self.model.setRotation(v)
2206        if self.callBackActive : self.parent.controller.changeGeometry(values)
2207
2208    def setValues(self, values, callBackActive = False):
2209        """
2210        Set all geometry parameters programmatically.
2211        
2212        Updates all geometric transformation controls simultaneously, typically
2213        used when loading saved geometry settings or batch updates.
2214        
2215        Args:
2216            values (dict): Dictionary containing geometry parameters including
2217                          'up' (vertical adjustment) and 'rotation' (angle)
2218            callBackActive (bool, optional): Whether to trigger callbacks (default: False)
2219        """
2220        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> GeometryController.setValue(",values,") ")
2221
2222        up =        values['up']        if 'up' in values.keys()        else 0.0
2223        rotation =  values['rotation']  if 'rotation' in values.keys()  else 0.0
2224
2225        self.callBackActive = callBackActive
2226
2227        self.view.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement.setValue(int(up))
2228        self.view.sliderRotation.setValue(int(rotation*6))
2229       
2230        self.model.setValues(values)
2231
2232        self.callBackActive = True

2346# ---- Class ColorEditorsAutoController ----------------------------------------------------
2347# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2348class  ColorEditorsAutoController:
2349    """
2350    Controller for automatic color editor configuration and management.
2351    
2352    This class provides automated color editing capabilities by analyzing image
2353    content and automatically configuring multiple color editor instances with
2354    optimal settings. It uses advanced algorithms to identify dominant colors
2355    and suggest appropriate editing parameters for professional color grading.
2356    
2357    The automatic color editor system streamlines the workflow for complex color
2358    corrections by providing intelligent starting points for manual fine-tuning.
2359    
2360    Attributes:
2361        - parent: Parent controller for coordination
2362        - controlled (list): List of controlled color editor instances
2363        - stepName (str): Processing step name for this auto-controller
2364        - model (model.ColorEditorsAutoModel): Auto-color editing data model
2365        - view (view.ColorEditorsAutoView): Auto-color editing interface
2366        - callBackActive (bool): Enable/disable callback processing
2367    """
2368    def __init__(self, parent, controlledColorEditors, stepName ):
2369        """
2370        Initialize the automatic color editors controller.
2371        
2372        Args:
2373            parent: Parent controller for coordination
2374            controlledColorEditors (list): List of color editor controllers to manage
2375            stepName (str): Processing step identifier for this auto-controller
2376        """
2377        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ColorEditorsAutoController.__init__(",") ")
2378
2379        self.parent = parent
2380        self.controlled = controlledColorEditors
2381        self.stepName =stepName
2382
2383        self.model =    model.ColorEditorsAutoModel(self, stepName,len(controlledColorEditors), removeBlack= True)
2384        self.view =     view.ColorEditorsAutoView(self)
2385
2386        self.callBackActive = True
2387    # callbacks
2388    def auto(self): 
2389        """
2390        Trigger automatic color editor configuration.
2391        
2392        Analyzes the current image to identify dominant colors and automatically
2393        configures all controlled color editors with appropriate selection ranges
2394        and initial editing parameters. Resets all editors before applying new
2395        automatic configurations.
2396        """
2397        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ColorEditorsAutoController.auto(",") ")
2398        for ce in self.controlled: ce.resetSelection(); ce.resetEdit()
2399        values = self.model.compute()
2400
2401        if values != None:
2402            for i,v in enumerate(values): self.controlled[i].setValues(v, callBackActive = False)
def getScreenSize(app): 
 86def getScreenSize(app):
 87    """
 88    Get screen resolution information for multi-monitor support.
 89    
 90    Queries the application for all available screens and returns their
 91    dimensions for HDR display configuration and window management.
 92    
 93    Args:
 94        app (QApplication): PyQt5 application instance
 95        
 96    Returns:
 97        list: List of QSize objects representing screen dimensions
 98    """
 99    screens = app.screens()
100    res = list(map(lambda x: x.size(), screens))
101    return res

Get screen resolution information for multi-monitor support.

Queries the application for all available screens and returns their dimensions for HDR display configuration and window management.

Args: app (QApplication): PyQt5 application instance

Returns: list: List of QSize objects representing screen dimensions

class GalleryMode(enum.Enum): 
105class GalleryMode(enum.Enum):
106    """
107    Enumeration for gallery display layout configurations.
108    
109    Defines different grid layouts for the image gallery, allowing users
110    to view multiple images simultaneously in various arrangements.
111    Each mode specifies the number of rows and columns for image display.
112    
113    Attributes:
114        - _1x1 (int): Single image view (1 row, 1 column)
115        - _3x2 (int): 32 grid layout (2 rows, 3 columns)
116        - _6x4 (int): 64 grid layout (4 rows, 6 columns)
117        - _9x6 (int): 96 grid layout (6 rows, 9 columns)
118        - _2x1 (int): 21 layout (1 row, 2 columns) for side-by-side comparison
119    """
120
121    _1x1         = 0         # 
122    _3x2         = 1         # 
123    _6x4         = 2         # 
124    _9x6         = 3         #
125    
126    _2x1        =  4
127
128    def nbRow(m):
129        """
130        Get the number of rows for a gallery mode.
131        
132        Args:
133            m (GalleryMode): Gallery mode enumeration value
134            
135        Returns:
136            int: Number of rows in the gallery layout
137        """
138        if m == GalleryMode._1x1: return 1
139        if m == GalleryMode._3x2: return 2
140        if m == GalleryMode._6x4: return 4
141        if m == GalleryMode._9x6: return 6
142
143        if m == GalleryMode._2x1: return 1
144    def nbCol(m):
145        """
146        Get the number of columns for a gallery mode.
147        
148        Args:
149            m (GalleryMode): Gallery mode enumeration value
150            
151        Returns:
152            int: Number of columns in the gallery layout
153        """
154        if m == GalleryMode._1x1: return 1
155        if m == GalleryMode._3x2: return 3
156        if m == GalleryMode._6x4: return 6
157        if m == GalleryMode._9x6: return 9
158
159        if m == GalleryMode._2x1: return 2

Enumeration for gallery display layout configurations.

Defines different grid layouts for the image gallery, allowing users to view multiple images simultaneously in various arrangements. Each mode specifies the number of rows and columns for image display.

Attributes: - _1x1 (int): Single image view (1 row, 1 column) - _3x2 (int): 32 grid layout (2 rows, 3 columns) - _6x4 (int): 64 grid layout (4 rows, 6 columns) - _9x6 (int): 96 grid layout (6 rows, 9 columns) - _2x1 (int): 21 layout (1 row, 2 columns) for side-by-side comparison

class ImageWidgetController: 
163class ImageWidgetController:
164    """
165    Controller for individual image widget components.
166    
167    Manages the display and interaction of individual image widgets within
168    the gallery and editing interface. Handles image loading, display
169    updates, and user interactions for single image components.
170    
171    Attributes:
172        - model (model.ImageWidgetModel): Data model for the image widget
173        - view (view.ImageWidgetView): View component for image display
174        - _id (int): Unique identifier for the widget
175    """
176
177    def __init__(self, image=None,id = -1):
178        """
179        Initialize an image widget controller.
180        
181        Args:
182            image (numpy.ndarray or hdrCore.image.Image, optional): Initial image to display
183            id (int, optional): Unique identifier for the widget (default: -1)
184        """
185
186        self.model = model.ImageWidgetModel(self)
187        self.view = view.ImageWidgetView(self)
188
189        self._id = id # store an (unique) id 
190
191        if isinstance(image, (np.ndarray, hdrCore.image.Image)):
192            self.model.setImage(image)
193            self.view.setPixmap(self.model.getColorData())
194
195    def setImage(self, image):
196        """
197        Update the image displayed in the widget.
198        
199        Args:
200            image (numpy.ndarray or hdrCore.image.Image): New image to display
201            
202        Returns:
203            QPixmap: Updated pixmap for the display
204        """
205        self.model.setImage(image)
206        return self.view.setPixmap(self.model.getColorData())
207
208    def setQPixmap(self, qPixmap):
209        """
210        Set the display pixmap directly.
211        
212        Args:
213            qPixmap (QPixmap): Pixmap to display in the widget
214        """
215        self.view.setQPixmap(qPixmap)
216
217    def id(self): 
218        """
219        Get the widget's unique identifier.
220        
221        Returns:
222            int: Unique identifier for this widget
223        """
224        return self._id

class ImageGalleryController: 
228class ImageGalleryController():
229    """
230    Controller for the image gallery interface.
231    
232    Manages the gallery view that displays multiple images in grid layouts,
233    handles pagination, gallery mode switching, and image selection. Provides
234    the main interface for browsing and selecting images for editing.
235    
236    The gallery supports multiple display modes (11, 32, 64, 96, 21) and
237    handles pagination when there are more images than can fit in the current view.
238    
239    Attributes:
240        - parent: Parent controller (typically AppController)
241        - view (view.ImageGalleryView): Gallery view component
242        - model (model.ImageGalleryModel): Gallery data model
243    """
244
245    def __init__(self, parent):
246        """
247        Initialize the image gallery controller.
248        
249        Args:
250            parent: Parent controller that manages this gallery
251        """
252        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.__init__()")
253
254        self.parent = parent    # AppView
255        self.view = view.ImageGalleryView(self)
256        self.model = model.ImageGalleryModel(self)
257
258    def setImages(self, imageFiles): 
259        """
260        Load a list of image files into the gallery.
261        
262        Args:
263            imageFiles (list): List of image file paths to load
264        """
265        self.model.setImages(imageFiles)
266
267    def updateImages(self):
268        """
269        Refresh the gallery display with current images.
270        
271        Called by the model when image data changes to update the view.
272        Resets the page number and refreshes the display.
273        """
274        self.view.pageNumber = 0 # reset page number
275        self.view.updateImages()
276
277    def callBackButton_previousPage(self):  
278        """
279        Navigate to the previous page in the gallery.
280        
281        Handles pagination when there are more images than can fit in the
282        current gallery view. In single image mode, also selects the image.
283        """
284        self.view.changePageNumber(-1)
285        if self.view.shapeMode == GalleryMode._1x1 : self.selectImage(0)
286
287    def callBackButton_nextPage(self):      
288        """
289        Navigate to the next page in the gallery.
290        
291        Handles pagination when there are more images than can fit in the
292        current gallery view. In single image mode, also selects the image.
293        """
294        self.view.changePageNumber(+1)
295        if self.view.shapeMode == GalleryMode._1x1 : self.selectImage(0)
296
297    def computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(self,newGalleryMode):
298        """
299        Calculate the appropriate page number when changing gallery modes.
300        
301        When switching between different gallery layouts, this method ensures
302        the currently selected or viewed image remains visible by calculating
303        the correct page number for the new layout.
304        
305        Args:
306            newGalleryMode (GalleryMode): Target gallery layout mode
307            
308        Returns:
309            int: Calculated page number for the new gallery mode
310        """
311        currentPage = self.view.pageNumber
312        nbImagePerPage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
313        selectedImage = self.model.selectedImage() if (self.model.selectedImage()!=-1) else currentPage*nbImagePerPage
314        newNbImagePerPage = GalleryMode.nbRow(newGalleryMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(newGalleryMode)
315
316        newPageNumber = selectedImage//newNbImagePerPage
317
318        return newPageNumber
319
320    def callBackButton_1x1(self):
321        """
322        Switch gallery to single image view mode (11).
323        
324        Changes the gallery layout to display one image at a time, suitable
325        for detailed viewing and editing. Recalculates pagination and updates
326        the display.
327        """
328        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._1x1:
329            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
330            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._1x1)
331            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._1x1
332            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
333            self.view.updateImages()
334            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
335            self.view.repaint()
336
337    def callBackButton_3x2(self): 
338        """
339        Switch gallery to 32 grid view mode.
340        
341        Changes the gallery layout to display 6 images in a 32 grid,
342        suitable for browsing multiple images while maintaining reasonable
343        image size for preview.
344        """
345        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._3x2:
346            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
347            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._3x2)
348            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._3x2
349            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
350            self.view.updateImages()
351            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
352            self.view.repaint()
353
354    def callBackButton_6x4(self): 
355        """
356        Switch gallery to 64 grid view mode.
357        
358        Changes the gallery layout to display 24 images in a 64 grid,
359        suitable for quick browsing of large image collections with
360        smaller thumbnail sizes.
361        """
362        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._6x4:
363            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
364            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._6x4)
365            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._6x4
366            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
367            self.view.updateImages()
368            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
369            self.view.repaint()
370
371    def callBackButton_9x6(self):
372        """
373        Switch gallery to 96 grid view mode.
374        
375        Changes the gallery layout to display 54 images in a 96 grid,
376        suitable for overview browsing of very large image collections
377        with small thumbnail sizes.
378        """
379        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._9x6:
380            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
381            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._9x6)
382            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._9x6
383            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
384            self.view.updateImages()
385            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
386            self.view.repaint()
387
388    def callBackButton_2x1(self):
389        """
390        Switch gallery to 21 comparison view mode.
391        
392        Changes the gallery layout to display 2 images side by side,
393        ideal for comparing different processing results or comparing
394        before/after versions of images.
395        """
396        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._2x1:
397            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
398            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._2x1)
399            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._2x1
400            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
401            self.view.updateImages()
402            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
403            self.view.repaint()
404
405    def selectImage(self, id):
406        """
407        Handle selection of an image in the gallery.
408        
409        Processes user selection of an image and updates the editing interface
410        to work with the selected image's processing pipeline.
411        
412        Args:
413            id (int): Index of the selected image within the current page
414        """
415        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.selectImage()")
416
417        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
418        idxImage = self.view.pageNumber*nbImagePage+id
419        # check id
420        if (idxImage < len(self.model.processPipes)):
421            # update selected image
422            processPipe = self.model.processPipes[idxImage]
423            if processPipe:
424                if self.parent.dock.setProcessPipe(processPipe):
425                    self.model.setSelectedImage(idxImage)
426
427    def getSelectedProcessPipe(self):
428        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.getSelectedProcessPipe()")
429        return self.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
430
431    def setProcessPipeWidgetQPixmap(self, qPixmap):
432        idxProcessPipe = self.model.selectedImage()
433        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
434        idxImageWidget = idxProcessPipe%nbImagePage
435        if pref.verbose:  print(" >> ImageGalleryController.setProcessPipeWidgetQPixmap(...)[ image id:",idxProcessPipe,">> image widget controller:",idxImageWidget,"]")
436        self.view.imagesControllers[idxImageWidget].setQPixmap(qPixmap)
437
438    def save(self):
439        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.save()")
440        self.model.save()
441
442    def currentPage(self): return self.view.currentPage()
443
444    def pageIdx(self):
445        nb = self.currentPage()
446        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
447        return (nb*nbImagePage), ((nb+1)*nbImagePage)
448
449    def getFilenamesOfCurrentPage(self): return self.model.getFilenamesOfCurrentPage()
450
451    def getProcessPipeById(self,i) : return self.model.getProcessPipeById(i)
452
453    def getProcessPipes(self): return self.model.processPipes

394        before/after versions of images.
395        """
396        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._2x1:
397            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
398            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._2x1)
399            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._2x1
400            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
401            self.view.updateImages()
402            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
403            self.view.repaint()

Switch gallery to 21 comparison view mode.

Changes the gallery layout to display 2 images side by side, ideal for comparing different processing results or comparing before/after versions of images.

def selectImage(self, id):

406        """
407        Handle selection of an image in the gallery.
408        
409        Processes user selection of an image and updates the editing interface
410        to work with the selected image's processing pipeline.
411        
412        Args:
413            id (int): Index of the selected image within the current page
414        """

416
417        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
418        idxImage = self.view.pageNumber*nbImagePage+id
419        # check id
420        if (idxImage < len(self.model.processPipes)):
421            # update selected image
422            processPipe = self.model.processPipes[idxImage]
423            if processPipe:
424                if self.parent.dock.setProcessPipe(processPipe):
425                    self.model.setSelectedImage(idxImage)

class AppController: 
457class AppController(object):
458    """
459    Main application controller implementing the MVC pattern.
460    
461    This class serves as the central controller for the uHDR application,
462    managing the main window, coordinating between different components,
463    and handling high-level application operations like file management,
464    HDR display, and image export functionality.
465    
466    The AppController orchestrates interactions between the image gallery,
467    editing interface, HDR viewer, and manages the application's workflow
468    from image loading to final export operations.
469    
470    Attributes:
471        - screenSize (list): Available screen dimensions for multi-monitor support
472        - hdrDisplay (HDRviewerController): HDR image display controller
473        - view (view.AppView): Main application view component
474        - model (model.AppModel): Main application data model
475        - dirName (str): Currently selected directory path
476        - imagesName (list): List of image filenames in current directory
477    """
478
479    def __init__(self, app):
480        """
481        Initialize the main application controller.
482        
483        Sets up the application's core components including screen detection,
484        HDR display initialization, and main view creation. Establishes the
485        foundation for the complete HDR editing workflow.
486        
487        Args:
488            app (QApplication): PyQt5 application instance for screen detection
489        """
490        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.__init__()")
491
492        self.screenSize = getScreenSize(app)# get screens size
493
494        # attributes
495        self.hdrDisplay = HDRviewerController(self)
496        self.view =  view.AppView(self, HDRcontroller = self.hdrDisplay)                         
497        self.model = model.AppModel(self)
498
499        self.dirName = None
500        self.imagesName = []
501        
502        self.view.show()
503    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
504
505    def callBackSelectDir(self):
506        """
507        Open directory selection dialog and load HDR images.
508        
509        Presents a file dialog for directory selection, discovers all supported
510        image files in the chosen directory, and loads them into the gallery.
511        Automatically saves any pending metadata before switching directories.
512        
513        The method handles the complete workflow of:
514        1. Directory selection via QFileDialog
515        2. Saving current image metadata
516        3. Discovering supported image formats
517        4. Loading images into the gallery view
518        5. Resetting HDR display to splash screen
519        """
520        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackSelectDir()")
521        dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory', self.model.directory)
522        if dirName != "":
523            # save current images (metadata)
524            self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
525            # get images in the selected directory
526            self.imagesName = []; self.imagesName = list(self.model.setDirectory(dirName))
527
528            self.view.imageGalleryController.setImages(self.imagesName)
529            self.hdrDisplay.displaySplash()
530    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
531    def callBackSave(self): 
532        """
533        Save current processing state and metadata.
534        
535        Triggers the gallery controller to save all current image metadata
536        and processing pipeline states to persistent storage.
537        """
538        self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
539    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
540    def callBackQuit(self):
541        """
542        Handle application shutdown with proper cleanup.
543        
544        Performs clean application exit by saving all metadata, closing
545        HDR display processes, and terminating the application gracefully.
546        Ensures no data loss during application closure.
547        """
548        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> AppController.callBackQuit()")
549        self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
550        self.hdrDisplay.close()
551        sys.exit()
552    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
553    def callBackDisplayHDR(self):
554        """
555        Display processed HDR image on external HDR monitor.
556        
557        Initiates the HDR display workflow by processing the currently selected
558        image at full resolution with the complete processing pipeline, then
559        sends the result to the external HDR display. Shows progress feedback
560        during the compute-intensive full-resolution processing.
561        
562        The workflow includes:
563        1. Retrieving selected processing pipeline
564        2. Saving processing metadata
565        3. Loading full-resolution source image
566        4. Resizing to display resolution
567        5. Applying complete processing pipeline
568        6. Threading the computation with progress updates
569        """
570
571        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackDisplayHDR()")
572
573        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
574
575        if selectedProcessPipe:
576            self.view.statusBar().showMessage('displaying HDR image, full size image computation: start, please wait !')
577            self.view.statusBar().repaint()
578            # save current processpipe metada
579            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage)
580            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = selectedProcessPipe.toDict()
581            originalImage.metadata.save()
582
583            # load full size image
584            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
585
586            # turn off: autoResize
587            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
588            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
589            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe)
590
591            # set size to display size
592            size = pref.getDisplayShape()
593            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.resize(),size=(None, size[1]))
594
595            # set image to process-pipe
596            processpipe.setImage(img)
597
598            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndDisplay, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)
599    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
600    def callBackEndDisplay(self, img):
601        """
602        Complete HDR display processing and send to external monitor.
603        
604        Finalizes the HDR display workflow by applying final processing steps
605        and sending the image to the external HDR display. Updates the status
606        bar to indicate completion.
607        
608        Args:
609            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Processed HDR image ready for display
610            
611        Note:
612            Re-enables auto-resizing after full-resolution processing and
613            applies display-specific scaling before HDR monitor output.
614        """
615
616        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackEndDisplay()")
617
618        # turn off: autoResize
619        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True  
620        
621        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('displaying HDR image, full size image computation: done !')
622
623        # clip, scale
624        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
625        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
626
627        colour.write_image(img.colorData,"temp.hdr", method='Imageio') # local copy for display
628        self.hdrDisplay.displayFile("temp.hdr")
629    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
630    def callBackCloseDisplayHDR(self):
631        """
632        Close HDR display and return to splash screen.
633        
634        Terminates the current HDR display session and returns the external
635        HDR monitor to the default splash screen state.
636        """
637        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackCloseDisplayHDR()")
638        self.hdrDisplay.displaySplash()
639    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
640    def callBackCompareRawEditedHDR(self):
641        """
642        Display side-by-side comparison of original and edited HDR images.
643        
644        Creates a comparison view showing the original unprocessed image
645        alongside the current edited version. Both images are displayed
646        at the same scale on the HDR monitor for direct visual comparison.
647        
648        The comparison workflow:
649        1. Loads original unprocessed image
650        2. Applies current processing pipeline
651        3. Resizes both images to fit side-by-side
652        4. Creates composite comparison image
653        5. Displays on HDR monitor with proper scaling
654        """
655
656        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackCompareOriginalInputHDR()")
657
658        # process real size image
659        # get selected process pipe
660        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
661
662        if selectedProcessPipe:         # check if a process pipe is selected
663
664            # read original image
665            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage.path+'/'+selectedProcessPipe.originalImage.name)
666
667            # resize
668            screenY, screenX = pref.getDisplayShape()
669
670            imgY, imgX,_ = img.shape
671
672            marginY = int((screenY - imgY/2)/2)
673            marginX = int(marginY/4)
674            imgXp = int((screenX - 3*marginX)/2)
675            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.resize(),size=(None,imgXp))
676            imgY, imgX, _ = img.shape
677
678            # original image after resize
679            ori = copy.deepcopy(img)
680
681            # build process pipe from selected one them compute
682            pp = hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe()
683            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False   # stop autoResize
684            params= []
685            for p in selectedProcessPipe.processNodes: 
686                pp.append(copy.deepcopy(p.process),paramDict=None, name=copy.deepcopy(p.name))
687                params.append({p.name:p.params})
688            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = params
689            pp.setImage(img)
690
691            res = hdrCore.coreC.coreCcompute(img, pp)
692            res = res.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
693            
694            imgYres, imgXres, _ = res.colorData.shape
695
696            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True    # return to autoResize
697
698            # make comparison image
699            oriColorData = ori.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
700            resColorData = res.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
701            display = np.ones((screenY,screenX,3))*0.2
702            marginY = int((screenY - imgY)/2)
703            marginYres = int((screenY - imgYres)/2)
704
705            display[marginY:marginY+imgY, marginX:marginX+imgX,:] = oriColorData
706            display[marginYres:marginYres+imgYres, 2*marginX+imgX:2*marginX+imgX+imgXres,:] = resColorData
707            
708            # save as compOrigFinal.hdr
709            colour.write_image(display,'compOrigFinal.hdr', method='Imageio')
710            self.hdrDisplay.displayFile('compOrigFinal.hdr')
711    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
712    def callBackExportHDR(self):
713        """
714        Export single HDR image with current processing applied.
715        
716        Initiates the HDR export workflow for the currently selected image,
717        allowing the user to choose the export destination and applying
718        the complete processing pipeline at full resolution.
719        
720        The export process includes:
721        1. User directory selection for output
722        2. Full-resolution image loading
723        3. Complete processing pipeline application
724        4. HDR-specific encoding and scaling
725        5. File output with appropriate metadata
726        """
727
728        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackExportHDR()") 
729
730        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
731
732
733        if selectedProcessPipe:
734            # select dir where to save export
735            self.dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory where to export HDR file', self.model.directory)
736
737            # show export message
738            self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR image ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'), full size image computation: start, please wait !')
739            self.view.statusBar().repaint()
740
741            # save current processpipe metada
742            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage)
743            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = selectedProcessPipe.toDict()
744            originalImage.metadata.save()
745
746            # load full size image
747            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
748
749            # turn off: autoResize
750            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
751            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
752            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe)
753
754            # set image to process-pipe
755            processpipe.setImage(img)
756
757            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)
758    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
759    def callBackEndExportHDR(self, img):
760        """
761        Complete single HDR export and save to disk.
762        
763        Finalizes the HDR export process by applying final processing,
764        saving to the selected directory, and optionally displaying
765        the result on the HDR monitor.
766        
767        Args:
768            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Processed HDR image ready for export
769        """
770        # turn off: autoResize
771        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True  
772        
773        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR image ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'), full size image computation: done !')
774
775        # clip, scale
776        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
777        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
778
779        if self.dirName:
780            pathExport = os.path.join(self.dirName, img.name[:-4]+pref.getHDRdisplay()['post']+'.hdr')
781            img.type = hdrCore.image.imageType.HDR
782            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None
783            img.metadata.metadata['display'] = pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']
784
785            img.write(pathExport)
786
787        colour.write_image(img.colorData,"temp.hdr", method='Imageio') # local copy for display
788        self.hdrDisplay.displayFile("temp.hdr")
789    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
790    def callBackExportAllHDR(self):
791        """
792        Initiate batch export of all HDR images in the gallery.
793        
794        Starts the batch export process for all images in the current gallery,
795        allowing users to export multiple processed HDR images with a single
796        operation. Provides progress feedback during the batch operation.
797        """
798        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackExportAllHDR()")
799
800        self.processPipes = self.view.imageGalleryController.getProcessPipes()
801
802        # select dir where to save export
803        self.dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory where to export HDR file', self.model.directory)
804        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting '+str(len(self.processPipes))+' HDR images ... please wait')
805        self.view.statusBar().repaint()
806        self.imageToExport = len(self.processPipes) ; self.imageExportDone = 0
807
808        pp = self.processPipes[0]
809
810        # save current processpipe metada
811        originalImage = copy.deepcopy(pp.originalImage)
812        originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = pp.toDict()
813        originalImage.metadata.save()
814
815        # load full size image
816        img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
817
818        # turn off: autoResize
819        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
820        # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
821        processpipe = copy.deepcopy(pp)
822
823        # set image to process-pipe
824        processpipe.setImage(img)
825
826        thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndAllExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)            
827    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
828    def callBackEndAllExportHDR(self, img):
829        """
830        Process single image in batch export and continue to next.
831        
832        Handles the completion of each individual image in the batch export
833        process, saves the current image, updates progress, and initiates
834        processing of the next image in the queue.
835        
836        Args:
837            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Current processed HDR image in batch
838            
839        Note:
840            Recursively processes all images in the batch until completion,
841            providing progress updates throughout the operation.
842        """
843        # last image ?
844        self.imageExportDone +=1
845
846        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR images ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'):'+str(int(100*self.imageExportDone/self.imageToExport))+'% done !')
847
848        # clip, scale
849        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
850        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
851
852        if self.dirName:
853            pathExport = os.path.join(self.dirName, img.name[:-4]+pref.getHDRdisplay()['post']+'.hdr')
854            img.type = hdrCore.image.imageType.HDR
855            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None
856            img.metadata.metadata['display'] = pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']
857
858            img.write(pathExport)
859
860        if self.imageExportDone == self.imageToExport :
861            # turn off: autoResize
862            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True
863        else:
864            pp = self.processPipes[self.imageExportDone]
865
866            if not pp:
867                img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(self.imagesName[self.imageExportDone], thumb=True)
868                pp = model.EditImageModel.buildProcessPipe()
869                pp.setImage(img)                      
870
871
872            # save current processpipe metada
873            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(pp.originalImage)
874            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = pp.toDict()
875            originalImage.metadata.save()
876
877            # load full size image
878            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
879
880            # turn off: autoResize
881            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
882            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
883            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(pp)
884
885            # set image to process-pipe
886            processpipe.setImage(img)
887
888            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndAllExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)

574
575        if selectedProcessPipe:
576            self.view.statusBar().showMessage('displaying HDR image, full size image computation: start, please wait !')
577            self.view.statusBar().repaint()
578            # save current processpipe metada
579            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage)
580            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = selectedProcessPipe.toDict()
581            originalImage.metadata.save()
582
583            # load full size image
584            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
585
586            # turn off: autoResize
587            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
588            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
589            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe)
590
591            # set size to display size
592            size = pref.getDisplayShape()
593            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.resize(),size=(None, size[1]))
594
595            # set image to process-pipe
596            processpipe.setImage(img)
597
598            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndDisplay, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)

def callBackCompareRawEditedHDR(self): 
640    def callBackCompareRawEditedHDR(self):
641        """
642        Display side-by-side comparison of original and edited HDR images.
643        
644        Creates a comparison view showing the original unprocessed image
645        alongside the current edited version. Both images are displayed
646        at the same scale on the HDR monitor for direct visual comparison.
647        
648        The comparison workflow:
649        1. Loads original unprocessed image
650        2. Applies current processing pipeline
651        3. Resizes both images to fit side-by-side
652        4. Creates composite comparison image
653        5. Displays on HDR monitor with proper scaling
654        """
655
656        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackCompareOriginalInputHDR()")
657
658        # process real size image
659        # get selected process pipe
660        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
661
662        if selectedProcessPipe:         # check if a process pipe is selected
663
664            # read original image
665            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage.path+'/'+selectedProcessPipe.originalImage.name)
666
667            # resize
668            screenY, screenX = pref.getDisplayShape()
669
670            imgY, imgX,_ = img.shape
671
672            marginY = int((screenY - imgY/2)/2)
673            marginX = int(marginY/4)
674            imgXp = int((screenX - 3*marginX)/2)
675            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.resize(),size=(None,imgXp))
676            imgY, imgX, _ = img.shape
677
678            # original image after resize
679            ori = copy.deepcopy(img)
680
681            # build process pipe from selected one them compute
682            pp = hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe()
683            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False   # stop autoResize
684            params= []
685            for p in selectedProcessPipe.processNodes: 
686                pp.append(copy.deepcopy(p.process),paramDict=None, name=copy.deepcopy(p.name))
687                params.append({p.name:p.params})
688            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = params
689            pp.setImage(img)
690
691            res = hdrCore.coreC.coreCcompute(img, pp)
692            res = res.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
693            
694            imgYres, imgXres, _ = res.colorData.shape
695
696            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True    # return to autoResize
697
698            # make comparison image
699            oriColorData = ori.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
700            resColorData = res.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
701            display = np.ones((screenY,screenX,3))*0.2
702            marginY = int((screenY - imgY)/2)
703            marginYres = int((screenY - imgYres)/2)
704
705            display[marginY:marginY+imgY, marginX:marginX+imgX,:] = oriColorData
706            display[marginYres:marginYres+imgYres, 2*marginX+imgX:2*marginX+imgX+imgXres,:] = resColorData
707            
708            # save as compOrigFinal.hdr
709            colour.write_image(display,'compOrigFinal.hdr', method='Imageio')
710            self.hdrDisplay.displayFile('compOrigFinal.hdr')

def callBackEndAllExportHDR(self, img): 
828    def callBackEndAllExportHDR(self, img):
829        """
830        Process single image in batch export and continue to next.
831        
832        Handles the completion of each individual image in the batch export
833        process, saves the current image, updates progress, and initiates
834        processing of the next image in the queue.
835        
836        Args:
837            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Current processed HDR image in batch
838            
839        Note:
840            Recursively processes all images in the batch until completion,
841            providing progress updates throughout the operation.
842        """
843        # last image ?
844        self.imageExportDone +=1
845
846        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR images ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'):'+str(int(100*self.imageExportDone/self.imageToExport))+'% done !')
847
848        # clip, scale
849        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
850        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
851
852        if self.dirName:
853            pathExport = os.path.join(self.dirName, img.name[:-4]+pref.getHDRdisplay()['post']+'.hdr')
854            img.type = hdrCore.image.imageType.HDR
855            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None
856            img.metadata.metadata['display'] = pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']
857
858            img.write(pathExport)
859
860        if self.imageExportDone == self.imageToExport :
861            # turn off: autoResize
862            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True
863        else:
864            pp = self.processPipes[self.imageExportDone]
865
866            if not pp:
867                img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(self.imagesName[self.imageExportDone], thumb=True)
868                pp = model.EditImageModel.buildProcessPipe()
869                pp.setImage(img)                      
870
871
872            # save current processpipe metada
873            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(pp.originalImage)
874            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = pp.toDict()
875            originalImage.metadata.save()
876
877            # load full size image
878            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
879
880            # turn off: autoResize
881            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
882            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
883            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(pp)
884
885            # set image to process-pipe
886            processpipe.setImage(img)
887
888            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndAllExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)

class MultiDockController: 
892class MultiDockController():
893    """
894    Controller for managing multiple docked panels in the interface.
895    
896    This class manages the docking system that allows switching between different
897    functional panels: EDIT (image editing), INFO (metadata/information), and
898    MIAM (aesthetics analysis). It provides seamless transitions between
899    different modes of interaction with the HDR images.
900    
901    The docking system allows users to focus on specific aspects of image
902    processing while maintaining a consistent workflow and shared processing
903    pipeline state across all panels.
904    
905    Attributes:
906        - parent: Parent controller (typically AppController)
907        - view (view.MultiDockView): Multi-panel view component
908        - model: Data model (currently None, uses child controllers' models)
909    """
910    def __init__(self,parent=None, HDRcontroller = None):
911        """
912        Initialize the multi-dock controller.
913        
914        Args:
915            parent: Parent controller for coordination
916            HDRcontroller: HDR display controller for HDR preview integration
917        """
918        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> MultiDockController.__init__()")
919
920        self.parent = parent
921        self.view = view.MultiDockView(self, HDRcontroller)
922        self.model = None
923    # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
924    def activateEDIT(self): 
925        """
926        Activate the image editing panel.
927        
928        Switches the interface to the image editing mode, providing access
929        to exposure, contrast, tone curves, color editing, and other HDR
930        processing controls.
931        """
932        self.switch(0)
933    def activateINFO(self): 
934        """
935        Activate the image information panel.
936        
937        Switches the interface to the metadata and information display mode,
938        showing EXIF data, processing history, and image properties.
939        """
940        self.switch(1)
941    def activateMIAM(self):  
942        """
943        Activate the aesthetics analysis panel.
944        
945        Switches the interface to the MIAM (aesthetics) analysis mode,
946        displaying image quality metrics, color palette analysis, and
947        aesthetic scoring information.
948        """
949        self.switch(2)
950    # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
951    def switch(self,nb):
952        """
953        Switch to the specified panel number.
954        
955        Args:
956            nb (int): Panel index (0=EDIT, 1=INFO, 2=MIAM)
957        """
958        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> MultiDockController.switch()")
959        self.view.switch(nb)
960    # --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
961    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe): 
962        """
963        Set the processing pipeline for the active panel.
964        
965        Propagates the processing pipeline to the currently active panel,
966        ensuring that all panels work with the same image and processing state.
967        
968        Args:
969            processPipe: Processing pipeline to apply to the active panel
970            
971        Returns:
972            bool: True if the pipeline was successfully set, False otherwise
973        """
974        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> MultiDockController.setProcessPipe(",processPipe.getImage().name,")")
975
976        return self.view.setProcessPipe(processPipe)

class EditImageController: 
 980class EditImageController:
 981    """
 982    Controller for HDR image editing interface and processing pipeline.
 983    
 984    This class manages the comprehensive HDR image editing workflow, providing
 985    controls for exposure, contrast, tone curves, saturation, color editing,
 986    geometry transformations, and processing pipeline management. It coordinates
 987    between the editing interface and the underlying HDR processing system.
 988    
 989    The controller handles real-time preview updates, auto-adjustment algorithms,
 990    parameter synchronization, and HDR display integration for immediate visual
 991    feedback during the editing process.
 992    
 993    Attributes:
 994        - parent: Parent controller for coordination
 995        - previewHDR (bool): Enable/disable HDR preview updates
 996        - controllerHDR: HDR display controller for real-time preview
 997        - view (view.EditImageView): Image editing interface view
 998        - model (model.EditImageModel): Image editing data model and processing
 999    """
1000
1001    def __init__(self, parent=None, HDRcontroller = None):
1002        """
1003        Initialize the image editing controller.
1004        
1005        Args:
1006            parent: Parent controller for coordination
1007            HDRcontroller: HDR display controller for real-time preview
1008        """

1010

1012

1014        self.controllerHDR = HDRcontroller
1015
1016        self.view = view.EditImageView(self)
1017        self.model = model.EditImageModel(self)
1018    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1019    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe): 
1020        """
1021        Set the processing pipeline for editing.
1022        
1023        Configures the editing interface to work with the specified processing
1024        pipeline, updating all controls and displays to reflect the current
1025        processing state.
1026        
1027        Args:
1028            processPipe: Processing pipeline containing image and processing nodes
1029            
1030        Returns:
1031            bool: True if the pipeline was successfully set, False otherwise
1032        """
1033        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> EditImageController.setProcessPipe(",")")
1034
1035        if self.model.setProcessPipe(processPipe):
1036
1037            # update view
1038            self.view.setProcessPipe(processPipe)
1039            self.view.imageWidgetController.setImage(processPipe.getImage())
1040
1041            self.view.plotToneCurve()
1042
1043            # update hdr viewer
1044            self.controllerHDR.displaySplash()
1045
1046            return True
1047        else:
1048            return False
1049    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1050    def getProcessPipe(self) : 
1051        """
1052        Get the current processing pipeline.
1053        
1054        Returns:
1055            ProcessPipe: Current processing pipeline with all applied operations
1056        """
1057        return self.model.getProcessPipe()
1058    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1059    def buildView(self,processPipe=None):
1060        """
1061        Build or rebuild the editing interface view.
1062        
1063        Reconstructs the editing interface, typically called when switching
1064        between different panels or when the interface needs to be refreshed.
1065        
1066        Args:
1067            processPipe: Optional processing pipeline to set during build
1068        """
1069        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> EditImageController.buildView(",")")
1070

This class manages the comprehensive HDR image editing workflow, providing controls for exposure, contrast, tone curves, saturation, color editing, geometry transformations, and processing pipeline management. It coordinates between the editing interface and the underlying HDR processing system.

The controller handles real-time preview updates, auto-adjustment algorithms, parameter synchronization, and HDR display integration for immediate visual feedback during the editing process.

class AdvanceSliderController: 
1278class AdvanceSliderController():
1279    """
1280    Controller for advanced slider controls with auto-adjustment capabilities.
1281    
1282    This class provides enhanced slider functionality with features like automatic
1283    value calculation, reset capabilities, and custom step sizes. It's used throughout
1284    the HDR editing interface for precise parameter control with additional
1285    automation features.
1286    
1287    The advanced slider combines manual adjustment with intelligent auto-adjustment
1288    algorithms, allowing users to fine-tune parameters manually or rely on
1289    automatic optimization algorithms.
1290    
1291    Attributes:
1292        - parent: Parent controller for coordination
1293        - view (view.AdvanceSliderView): Slider interface component
1294        - model (model.AdvanceSliderModel): Slider data model
1295        - step (float): Step size for slider increments
1296        - defaultValue (float): Default/reset value for the slider
1297        - range (tuple): Minimum and maximum values for the slider
1298        - callBackActive (bool): Enable/disable callback processing
1299        - callBackValueChange: Callback function for value changes
1300        - callBackAutoPush: Callback function for auto-adjustment
1301    """
1302    def __init__(self, parent,name, defaultValue, range, step,callBackValueChange=None,callBackAutoPush= None):
1303        """
1304        Initialize the advanced slider controller.
1305        
1306        Args:
1307            parent: Parent controller for coordination
1308            name (str): Display name for the slider
1309            defaultValue (float): Default value for reset functionality
1310            range (tuple): (min, max) range for slider values
1311            step (float): Step size for value increments
1312            callBackValueChange: Callback function for value changes
1313            callBackAutoPush: Callback function for auto-adjustment
1314        """
1315        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AdvanceSliderController.__init__(",") ")
1316        self.parent = parent
1317
1318        self.view = view.AdvanceSliderView(self,  name, defaultValue, range, step)
1319        self.model = model.AdvanceSliderModel(self, value=defaultValue)
1320
1321        self.step = step
1322        self.defaultValue = defaultValue
1323        self.range = range
1324
1325        self.callBackActive = True
1326        self.callBackValueChange = callBackValueChange
1327        self.callBackAutoPush = callBackAutoPush
1328    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1329    def sliderChange(self):
1330        """
1331        Handle manual slider value changes.
1332        
1333        Processes slider movement events, updates the model and display,
1334        and triggers the value change callback if active. Converts slider
1335        position to actual value using the configured step size.
1336        """
1337
1338        value = self.view.slider.value()*self.step
1339
1340        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> AdvanceSliderController.sliderChange(",value,")[callBackActive:",self.callBackActive,"] ")
1341
1342        self.model.value = value
1343        self.view.editValue.setText(str(value))
1344        if self.callBackActive and self.callBackValueChange: self.callBackValueChange(value)
1345    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1346    def setValue(self, value, callBackActive = True):
1347        """
1348        Set slider value programmatically.
1349        
1350        Updates the slider position and display to reflect the specified value,
1351        with optional callback suppression for initialization or batch updates.
1352        
1353        Args:
1354            value (float): New value to set
1355            callBackActive (bool, optional): Whether to trigger callbacks (default: True)
1356        """
1357        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AdvanceSliderController.setValue(",value,") ")
1358
1359        """ set value value in 'model' range"""
1360        self.callBackActive = callBackActive
1361        self.view.slider.setValue(int(value/self.step))
1362        self.view.editValue.setText(str(value))
1363        self.model.setValue(int(value))
1364
1365        self.callBackActive = True
1366    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1367    def reset(self):
1368        """
1369        Reset slider to its default value.
1370        
1371        Restores the slider to its initial default value and triggers
1372        the value change callback to update dependent processing.
1373        """
1374        if pref.verbose : print(" [CB] >> AdvanceSliderController.reset(",") ")
1375

The advanced slider combines manual adjustment with intelligent auto-adjustment algorithms, allowing users to fine-tune parameters manually or rely on automatic optimization algorithms.

1393class ToneCurveController():
1394    """
1395    Controller for tone curve editing with B-spline interpolation.
1396    
1397    This class manages the tone curve editing interface, allowing users to adjust
1398    the luminance mapping through control points that define a smooth B-spline curve.
1399    It includes automatic curve generation using machine learning, histogram overlay
1400    display, and comprehensive curve visualization options.
1401    
1402    The tone curve is a fundamental HDR processing tool that maps input luminance
1403    values to output values, effectively controlling the overall tone mapping
1404    and local contrast of the image.
1405    
1406    Attributes:
1407        - parent: Parent controller for coordination
1408        - model (model.ToneCurveModel): Tone curve mathematical model
1409        - view (view.ToneCurveView): Curve editing interface
1410        - callBackActive (bool): Enable/disable callback processing
1411        - showInput (bool): Display input image histogram
1412        - showbefore (bool): Display pre-curve histogram
1413        - showAfter (bool): Display post-curve histogram  
1414        - showOutput (bool): Display final output histogram
1415        - weightFile (str): Machine learning model file for auto-curve
1416        - networkModel: PyTorch neural network for automatic curve generation
1417    """

1505        self.view.editBlacks.setText(str(valuesDict["blacks"][1]))
1506

1508        self.view.editMediums.setText(str(valuesDict["mediums"][1]))
